loans.name: 10 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hưng is 52 years old and is married with two children and no dependents. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hưng has a retail business selling coal. She has been involved in this business for five years. 
Hưng is the group leader of the 10 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal to resell. This is Hưng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Hưng faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profits, Hưng hopes to maintain a successful business, ensure that her family is healthy and happy, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase coal for resale.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Basilisa has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Basilisa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with three children; two attend school, while one is still too young.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  He operates a carpentry business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of establishing a well-furnished workshop in the future.

With his KES 20,000 loan, George wants to purchase timber. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 and has one school-age child. She is a single parent because she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she has strong faith and determination to improve their status of living and give her child a better future. 

She owns and manages a variety store in their village selling grocery items, soft drinks and rice. She has been in this business for almost seven years earning a net profits of P10,000 a month that she uses to acquire their necessities and support the education of her child. 

She aims to acquire additional stocks of grocery items to sell in her store but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 32,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, snack foods, candies, soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and rice to sell in her store. 

She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business as she continues to work hard despite the hardships and difficulties she encounters in life. She dreams that someday, her business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, snack foods, candies, soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and rice to sell in her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and married with four children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, egg, noodles, spices, etc. 

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Celestina works hard to support her family.

She has a business making coconut charcoal in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Celestina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy coconut shells for her coconut charcoal making business.

Celestina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of providing a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy coconut shells to make charcoal

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 40 years old and married with two children.

Neneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business fattening pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

Neneth has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pig fattening business for 10 years and earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Neneth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en:
From Banteay Meanchey, Mrs. Soeut is a businesswoman who has a home-based store. She opened this business over one year ago. She sells various items such as candles, sugar, candy, beer and grocery food. She earns around $3 US each day. To generate more income, her husband is running a business as a local construction worker. They have five children. One of her children is employed as a building worker and he always shares his low income with Mrs. Soeut to help cover the financial expenses. Four children are single and still students. 

Mrs. Soeut would like to apply for a loan of $1,100 US to buy a new motorcycle for her son to ride to his workplace. This loan can reduce their motor taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her son to ride to his workplace.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is from the village Mukhrani in the Mtskheta district. She is 43 years old and lives with her parents, who are retired. She is the only income provider in the family and agricultural activities are the main source of income for them. 

Maya has two milk cows. She produces and sells on average 40 kg. of cheese per month. She sells it to local dairy products retailers. Along with the dairy, Maya is also busy with her winery. She has a vineyard and produces wine, which is also sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL (including the pensions of Maya’s parents). 

Maya requested credit to purchase two calves and feed for them. She will raise the calves during the winter and sell them by spring for a higher price. Maya will get additional income and will use it for purchasing new household goods, in order to improve the family's living conditions. Also part of the credit will be used for renovation of a small part of the house, as it is old and in bad condition.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and food for them and pay for house renovation services.

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is 30 years old and married.  She has two children. The youngest child is 8 and oldest one is 10 years old. Gülcan has been making “güpür” (a handmade accessory made of silk, a kind of lacework) for four years.  At first, she began making “güpür” in her house, but now she is teaching other women how to do “güpür”. Moreover, she is also painting the handmade “güpür”.  In addition, she has been selling tobacco for eight months and she wants to buy some more tobacco for her as the bayram (religious celebration for Moslems) is coming. This is the reason for her application to Maya for a loan.

With the loan from Maya, Gülcan thinks that she is one more step closer to her dreams.  She wants to be a great housewife and an employer.  She thinks that she will be able to reach her dreams with her self-confidence. Gülcan also wants to buy a house by herself and work for her children’s education and future. She is an ambitious, patient, resolute and successful woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Gülcan Hanım 30 yaşında  ve  evli.  İki çocuğu var ,en büyüğü 10 ,en küçüğü 8 yaşında.
Gülcan hanım dükkanında 4 yıldır  sadece güpür işi yapıyordu.  Güpür işine evinde yaparak başlamıştı,şimdi ise  bayanlara güpür  işini yaptırıyor.  Güpürde boya işi de yapıyor.  Güpür ün yanında 8 aydır tütünde satıyor.  Dükkanında bayram geldiği için biraz tütün almak istiyor.  Bu yüzden maya dan kredi almaya karar vermiş.  Maya dan kredi alarak hedeflerine bir adım daha yakın olacağını düşünüyor.  İyi bir iş kadını ve iş veren olmak istiyor.  Kendine olan özgüveni ile bunu başaracağını düşünüyor.
İleride kendine ait evinin olmasını istiyor.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak ve okumaları için elinden geleni yapmak istiyor.

Gülcan Hanım,azimli,sabırlı  ve başarılı bir kadın

loans.use: to buy more tobacco

loans.name: Jennery

texts.en:
Jennery works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Jennery has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from e-loading.

Jennery requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy material for her tailoring business. In the future, Jennery would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a weaving business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale business in the future. 

With her KES 15,000 loan, Tabu wants to purchase weaving materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 52 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Nelly has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

Nelly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Mrs. Pom is a rice cultivator from the Ornlong Veng District of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She started this business many years ago. She is married to Mr. Sak who runs a business alongside her. She and her husband have five children who are living under their care. All of her children are school-aged. The couple always works hard to provide for their children so that they could live a good lifestyle and receive a good education. She and her husband planted their rice crops two months ago but they are not growing well. Therefore, Mrs. Pom and her husband are asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and pesticides for protection of the crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides for protection of her crops.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 56 years old and married with 7 children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying & selling dried fish.

Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with nine children; two still attend school, while seven have already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a basket-weaving business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With her KES 15,000 loan, Mwanasha wants to purchase building materials, timber and blocks so she can construct a permanent home. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, timber and blocks so she can construct a permanent home

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Diana requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Diana has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Diana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Celma

texts.en: Celma is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal, bamboo and coconut. Celma requested a 25,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. Celma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation.  

For the past 20 years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from her home to neighbours and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With her KES 35,000 loan, Mwanajuma wants to purchase timber posts and barbed wire to fence her plot. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber posts and barbed wire to fence her plot.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Norma is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 52 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane and rice. Charito requested a 25,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Charito hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Dovdonnyam

texts.en:
Dovdonnyam, 46, lives with her two daughters in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) in Tosontsengel province. One of her daughters is an elementary school student. 

Dovdonnyam operates a grocery trading business. She started her retailing business in 2006 and now she wants to expand her business. 

Dovdonnyam is a hardworking woman who is taking care of her two daughters alone. She believes that one day she will be a successful and well experienced business woman. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 43 years old and married with 3 children.  For the past 10 years she has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from running a sari-sari store and farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: As a married mother of 3 children, Josephine works hard to support her family.  She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising pigs, farming sugarcane and catering. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing business

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en: Lonie is 50 years old and married with 3 children.  For the past 14 years she has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income by farming rice.  She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en: Asteria is 58 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 8 years. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing tools.  She would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing tools

loans.name: Volonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui habitent la même localité. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Josita Olga, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Josita Olga est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Barthelemy. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Josita Olga et son mari subviennent ensemble aux différents besoins du ménage. Josita Olga n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de trois ans que Josita Olga mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Josita Olga s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Josita Olga désire obtenir un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU.
texts.en:
The group VOLONTE DE DIEU is comprised of three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative is Josita Olga, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the goal of boosting their business. 

Josita Olga is 41 years old and married to a driver by the name of Barthelemy. They have five children, all in school. Three of the children are their own. The family lives together. Josita Olga and her husband jointly cover the various household expenses. 

Josita Olga did not attend school. For three years, she has been running a business selling charcoal out of her home. Her supplies come from a city in Benin. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and responding better to the demands of their customers, she and the other members of the group VOLONTE DE DIEU would like to obtain a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita believes that through patience and hard work, her family will overcome poverty. She is a mother who was blessed with three children. To generate additional income, she engages in selling dried fish and fish sauce to the people in her community. She has been in this business for almost three years earning a profits of PHP 5,000 a month that she uses for food and the allowances of the children. 

She aims to improve the business and continue sending her children to school, but she lacks enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of  PHP 7,000 to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell in their village. She believes that through this loan, she can increase her income to support her family needs. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow and their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell in their village.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Beverli

texts.en: Beverli is 53 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 26 years she has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She also earns an income from fishing.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.  Beverli has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this one. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng, 46, resides in the Prey Chor district. She is a married woman who has six children. One of her children has already married and lives independently. 

Currently, Mrs. Chheng raises some pigs behind her house. From this business, she can earn approximately $1 each day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a carpenter. He can generate a little income with Mrs. Chheng for using for the daily expenses. 

In order to make more revenue, Mrs. Chheng has decided with her family to request some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to buy additional pig feed and piglets. She hopes these funds will make her family meet happiness and prosperity, and gain more benefit.

loans.use: to buy additional pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a mat weaving business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With her KES 15,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated a weaving business. She sells her products at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her primary challenge as of late is the high cost of transportation to her workplace. Halima dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to renovate her house and to purchase timber, blocks, and cement. She decided to join Yehu to gain access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her house and to purchase timber, blocks, and cement.

loans.name: Aiymkan's Group

texts.en:
Aiymkan is the treasurer of this group. She is a 48-years-old, married woman. Together with her husband she has raised a son and a daughter; both of their children are working in Russia. Aiymkan, with the help of her husband, breeds livestock to earn additional money.

Aiymkan applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase furniture for her younger sister’s dowry. She explains that her sister is getting married soon. In the future, Aiymkan wants to see her daughter get married. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is hardworking and is a patient father to his two children. He is 51 years old and is married to Emelita. He is thankful because, though he was only able to finish elementary school, he is able to effectively manage his hog-raising business.

He is aiming to buy additional feed stocks because his hog-raising business is far from the market, yet he has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, he is asking for a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP, which would be used to feed his piglets well. In this regard, he could sell his pigs for higher prices, which would in turn allow him to improve his family's standard of living and to save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Tsagaanbaatar

texts.en:
Tsagaanbaatar is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter. His wife is a cook, but she has been helping her husband with his carpentry work since 2010. His daughter, who is 22 years old, graduated from university.

He started his business in 1990 by making small wood products. Now his business is doing well. He is confident that his business will be successful. His dream is to teach the next generation about wood products and techniques. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more wood.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Fausta, who is in her late twenties, is married with two children. Her children both attend school. She has been a tailor since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 8 pm and, by doing so, is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This would be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy tailoring items and a sewing machine, and for household expenses. She has paid all of her loans back successfully. She is now seeking a loan to buy more and different types of materials. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling fabrics and sarongs.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Becham," which has a total of 15 members, all of whom hold each other accountable in paying back their portions of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old single man who has been raising cows for 35 years. Ali is a hard worker who developed his business a lot through his vast experience in this field. The milk his cows produce and he sells is highly requested in the region because of its good quality. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time to buy the necessary food for his cows in big quantities with a special discount to save for the winter season. Ali's vast experience in this field gives him the privilege among all his competitors. He plans to increase his cattle more and more in the future and to expand his farm and production.

loans.use: To buy feef for his cows in big quantities

loans.name: Mahudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Florence Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Florence Viviane est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à Kadafia, un enseignant. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Florence Viviane a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Florence Viviane vend depuis cinq ans, des  produits divers (condiments de sauce, œufs frais, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans son quartier. Florence Viviane s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin . Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Florence Viviane et les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO sollicitent auprès de ALIDé pour une deuxième fois son aide financier. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group MAHUDJRO is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Florence Viviane, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and married to Kadafia, a teacher. They have three children to support. Two of the children are their own, and all of them are in school and living together with their parents. The couple jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. 

Florence Viviane dropped out of middle school. To support herself and her children, she has been selling various products for five years (sauce condiments, fresh eggs, pasta, etc.) in her district. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the demands of their customers. Florence Viviane and the other members of the group MAHUDJRO are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the second time. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy various goods (sauce condiments, trays of fresh eggs, and pasta)

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 32 years old. She is from the village of Dzalisi, Mtskheta District, East Georgia. Nato is married and lives with her family, which includes her husband Roland, her two-year-old son and retired parents (68 and 71 years old). Roland works in the State Ministry of Defense where he is a soldier.  

Nato is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own two pigs and 10 piglets. Nato sells on average 20 piglets per year. Along with the pig farm, the family owns a 300 sq meter greenhouse, which is used for growing cucumbers and tomatoes. The total average monthly income from the agriculture is 500 Laris. 

Nato requested a loan to develop the pig farm. She will repair the existing pigsty and purchase additional piglets, which will be raised on the farm. After a couple of the months, the piglets will be sold for a higher price. Nato plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, in order to increase the amount of pigs in the business, which will give them more piglets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and materials for repairing the pigsty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and coconut wine by the bottle.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married and has four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by selling fish at home and at a local market to both neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the high cost of transportation, and her dream for the future is being able to open up a butcher shop. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy fishing nets for her business, and decided to join Yehu to secure the loans she needs to make this possible.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with seven children; three attend school while four have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to her neighburs and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase thirteen sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase thirteen sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
To make her living, Mary Rose has engaged in the sale of lipstick, lotions and perfumes for 15 years. She also sells cooked snack foods like banana-que and barbe-que. Mary Rose is 43 years of age and blessed with three children.

With the profits earned from her business, Mary Rose was able to send two of her children to school and is proud to share that they are now professionals.

Mary Rose is industrious. She continues to manage her business and hopes to improve her income and allow her third child to finish his college courses.

Mary Rose needs additional capital of P10,000 to buy eggs, bananas, flour and sugar for the ingredients of her cooked snack foods.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bananas, flour and sugar for the ingredients of her cooked snack foods.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa  is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Nimfa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Nimfa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with eight family members, three of whom work. Since 2008 he has owned a barber shop where he offers services including haircutting, coloring and texturing in addition to shaving and trimming beards. He has 5 years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well-known in his area.

Ghaith is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate, redecorate and make a digital advertising box for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate, redecorate and make a digital advertising box for his barbershop

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Letecia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Shuru's Group

texts.en:
Shuru is the leader of this group.  She is 59 years old and married to a farmer. Shuru is a heroic mother; she has raised six daughters and two sons. All the children except the youngest son are married and live separately with their families. The family is engaged in livestock breeding and cultivation of agricultural products. With money received from the loan Shuru wants to purchase more livestock for breeding.  In the future she wants to increase the number of livestock, which will lead to an improvement of the family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Noubignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUBIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Roseline Nadia, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Roseline Nadia est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à Sylvain, un tailleur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Roseline Nadia et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Roseline Nadia vend des chaussures et divers articles (conserves, sucre, lait, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Roseline Nadia s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Roseline Nadia et les autres membres du groupe NOUBIGNON sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group NOUBIGNON is comprised of three persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Roseline Nadia. In the photo, she is the one with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and married to Sylvain, a tailor. They have three children, who are all in school. The family lives together in the same house. 

Roseline Nadia and her husband jointly provide for the need of their home. To do so, Roseline Nadia sells footwear and a variety of items (canned foods, sugar, milk, etc.) at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the demands of their customers, Roseline Nadia and the other members of the group NOUBIGNON are requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy shoes, boxes of sugar and milk, and some canned foods

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a responsible father whose aim is to educate all five of his children so that they will earn their degrees and become professionals. He is 47 years old and two of his children are still in college. He has been one of the Jeepney drivers in his village for almost 10 years. He earns an income of P10,000 a month. At present, they are suffering a shortage of funds due to the high cost of commodities and school fees. He is strongly determined to improve their standard of living and become more successful in the future.  

As a result, he is asking for additional capital of P9,000 to buy gasoline, tires, oil and tools needed for his Jeepney in order to provide better service. He mentioned that this loan will allow him to continue to use his Jeepney for passenger transportation. He believes that with patience and hard work, he will cover his family's needs and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, tires, oil and tools needed for his Jeepney

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children. One attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eleven years, she has operated a weaving business. She sells mats at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase materials for weaving mats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving mats.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife, two children and one family member who works.

K. has owned a large electric generator since 2008, leasing electric lines for his area and its surroundings. He worked in this field for four years so he has good experience and a good reputation; he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a new large electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a new large electric generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to cover market demand

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
 
Brenda has a food cart that cooks & sells street foods like kikiam, fishballs & tempura. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients like tempura & kikiam for sale.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like tempura & kikiam for sale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children. Three attend school while four are still too young for school. She lives in a house that she owns which does not have electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu operates a dry fish sales business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Saumu dreams of expanding her business and also establishing a motorcycle business to provide transportation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad, a borrower from Iraq, is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. A tailor since 2000, Saad owns a shop where he repairs and alters clothing professionally, especially suits and men's clothing. With more than ten years of experience in this field, he has a deep understanding of local customers and knows their needs. He enjoys a good reputation and is well-known in his area.

Saad is requesting a $1200 loan in order to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: in order to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 31 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.  For the past 5 years she has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines, where sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  In the future Divina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more construction materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 62 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns income from farming sugarcane. Rosalina requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Rosalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 50 years old and married with four children. Guillerma works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her stall.

Guillerma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, fruits and vegetables. 

Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh is a 31-year-old who lives with his two brothers in a house which he built in his own hands in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Battogtoh operates a taxi service business. He has been doing this service since 2005. He started his business by driving a Hyundai Excel and now that business has expanded, he is driving a Hyundai Accent. 

Due to his many years of service, he has many regular customers. By doing the business, he feeds his family members. He is a diligent man who says, "I love what I do; it feels good to serve others and soon I will be buying a new car." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to buy a motor for his car and to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy a motor and to repair his house.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 38 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. Her husband is a welder in the Philippines while Eden makes herself busy by selling balut (eggs with embryos sold boiled as a snack) to her customers in their village. She learned how to sell balut to her neighbors and she is glad that she has been in her business for four years.
Eden is applying for a loan of P10,000 to purchase eggs for making balut. This loan will help her in buying a sufficient volume of eggs to purchase at the wholesale price. Eden believes that she will earn a higher income after taking advantage of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for making balut.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. Tomasa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a very patient mother who does things the right way for the success of her family. At the age of 32, Annalyn already has four children. Annalyn makes dresses while she is at her sari-sari store where she sells eggs, canned goods, and fabric conditioner. 
With a vision and mission to respond to her duties and responsibilities to her family, Annalyn does as much as she can to achieve it. She wants to give opportunities to her children by sending them to finish their studies to provide for their future.
Annalyn wants to borrow P10,000 to buy noodles, cooking oil, and dried fish to satisfy the needs of her customers in the village. This loan will assist her in growing her business which would be beneficial to her success.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oil, and dried fish to satisfy the needs of her customers in the village.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of buying and selling farm products, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish a shop to sell her products in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items including slippers, blouses, and pants to sell. In the future, Zita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like slippers, blouses, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim, a borrower from Iraq, is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children. Since 2000, Karim has owned a carpentry workshop where he constructs, erects, installs, and repairs structures and fixtures made from wood and other materials. He is also involved in the installation of kitchen cabinets.

With more than eleven years of experience in this field, he has a deep understanding of local consumers, enjoys a good reputation for his work, and is well-known in his area.

Karim is requesting a $3000 loan to purchase a diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman with five children; two attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four months, she has operated a business of cooking food for resale at an open-air market. Her potential customers are passersby and neighbors. She faces a challenge of an inadequate supply of food for the business. She dreams of expanding to establish a food stall in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 56 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Florentina has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling soft drinks both wholesale and retail. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Florentina is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Rice farming is Milagros' primary source of income. She is 49 years old and married. Together with her husband, she patiently works hard to keep improving their crop production. She usually gets a yield twice a year. From her half hectare plot of land, she earns P15,000 during the month of May and November. Profits earned are just enough to cover her family's consumption such as monthly electric bills, daily meals and allowances for her three children.

Milagros is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and insecticides, and to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings. She wants to improve her crop production and generate more income from it.

Milagros would like to keep producing an abundant harvest in order to save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and insecticides, and to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 55 years old and is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Lydia has run a variety store in the Philippines where she sells items such as biscuits, soap, and other grocery products. 

Lydia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Geraldine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Geraldine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 18 years, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing at her business in the Philippines.

Paz is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing items such as pants and blouses to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 54-year-old married man, living with his wife and one child. He's been selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. This long experience helps in attracting many customers who seek good quality products.

Haidar is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to increase his merchandise with tasty seasonal fruits and vegetables. He will also complete building his house to keep it suitable for healthy living. This is Haidar's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a very good paying back history. He is insisting on expanding his business to fulfill his family's and customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with tasty seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a borrower from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and three children. Since 1990, Haydar has owned a carpentry workshop. He constructs, erects, installs, and repairs structures, fixtures, and doors made from wood and other materials. Haydar also installs kitchen cabinets. He has more than twenty years experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well-known in his community.

Haydar is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to pay rent for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en: Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to an engineer. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and a daughter. The sons are farmers and the daughter studies at school. The family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock to earn money for a livelihood. Selling part of the harvest, Dinara earns about 5,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to increase her livestock. In the future, Dinara wishes to build a house for her older son. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Felicitas has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Felicitas  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felicitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Colletar

texts.en:
Colletar is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past nine months, she has operated a cosmetic shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business to a wholesale shop. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics and bundles of clothes for another business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and bundles of clothes for another business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвелу 50 лет; он проживает в городе Ванадзоре. Жена Самвела работает учительницей в средней школе, старший сын учиться в Ереванском Государственном Медицинском Университете, а младший учится в школе.  
Более 10 лет Самвел плотницким делом. Он переделал одну из комнат своего дома в мастерскую, где он мастерит изделия из дерева. Самвел принимает заказы на изготовление мебели, а сделанные из дерева сувениры и нарды он продает в арендованном помещении в городском универмаге. Там же он продает настольные часы и картины, привезенные из Еревана. 
Изделия Самвела отличаются высоким качеством, вкусом и мастерством. Он вырезает на мебели и на нардах очень сложные орнаменты, благодаря чему у него всегда есть новые заказы. Бизнес позволяет Самвелу содержать семью и платить за обучение старшего сына. Для увеличения доходов своей семьи, Самвел хочет начать торговлю керамической посудой, вазами, статуэтками и т.д. Для этого ему необходим кредит на сумму 1,000,000 драм.
texts.en: Samvel is 50 years old.  He lives in the town of Vanadzor.  Samvel's wife works as a teacher at a secondary school, oldest son attends the Yerevan State Medical University, and the youngest son attends school.  Samvel has been involved in carpentry for over 10 years.  He re-purposed one of the rooms in his house into a workshop, where he makes products from wood.  Samvel accepts orders for making furniture and sells wooden souvenirs in a leased space at the city department store.  He also sells table clocks and paintings from Yerevan there.  Samvel's products stand out due to its high quality, taste and mastery.  He cuts very difficult ornaments on the furniture and backgammon, which is why he always has new orders.  This business allows Samvel to support his family and pay for his oldest son's education.  In order to increase his family's income, Samvel wants to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.  He needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram for this purpose.

loans.use: to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она продает детскую одежду на одном из рынков в своем городе. Ирина занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ей очень нравиться продавать детскую одежду, помогать родителям подбирать для своих детей нужные им вещи. Ирина - трудолюбивая и ответственная. Ее бизнес цель - открыть еще одну точку на этом же рынке. Это позволит Ирине обслуживает большее количество клиентов и увеличит ее обороты. Ирина просить предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку теплой детской одежды.
texts.en: Irina is married and has two children.  She sells children's clothing at one of the markets in her town.  Irina has been involved in this business for 11 years.  She likes selling children's clothing and helping parents pick necessary things for their children.  Irina is a hardworking and responsible person.  Her business goal is to open another retail outlet at the same market.  This would allow Irina to serve more customers and increase her goods turnover.  Irina is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia for the purchase of warm children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothing

loans.name: Felsie

texts.en:
Felsie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Felsie has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON for sale.
Felsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Felsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products from NATASHA & AVON for sale

loans.name: Battur

texts.en: Battur lives with his wife and 3 kids in a ger a traditional nomadic tent in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife stays at home. Two of his kids are elementary school students, the other is an infant. Battur operates a furniture-making business. He started his business in 2010. He has a bright vision that he will be a successful and well-experienced businessman. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood materials from Jargal sum (a county in the Huvsgul Province)

loans.use: To purchase more wood material

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and kerosene. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and kerosene.

loans.name: Melony

texts.en:
With her desire to earn money and be able to sustain her family needs, Melony worked in a restaurant for years. Due to the sickness suffered by her mother-in-law, she stopped working in the restaurant and decided to put up a small business.

Melony has two children in school. With her determination to help her husband bring up their family, Melony cooks and sells balut (fertilized duck or chickens eggs with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell) around their village. She doesn’t want to depend on her husband's remittances from abroad. Her dreams is for her children to finish their college level of education to have a better future.

Melony is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy stocks of eggs to make balut. She believe that this loan will help her financially support her business to develop and attain her dreams.

loans.use: to buy stock of eggs to make balut.

loans.name: Ubaydulo

texts.ru: Убайдуло проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него 10 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Трое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, по специальности он бухгалтер. В этой области он проработал 14 лет. Кроме того у него имеется грузовая машина, на которой он предоставляет услугу жителям района. Еще Убайдуло занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Ubaydulo lives in the A. Jomi district.  He is 48 years old, married and has 10 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Three of his sons are in Russia for work.  Ubaydulo has a secondary specialized education and is an accountant.  He spent 14 years working in that field.  Besides this, he owns a truck, which he uses to provide a service to the district residents.  Ubaydulo is also involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for future sale.  He has been in this business for 8 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Nouratou

texts.fr:
Nouratou est une femme  âgé(e) de 47ans. Nouratou est mariée à un cambiste. 
Nouratou travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et des produits pharmaceutiques depuis 1980. 
Nouratou vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Nouratou achète les produits au  NIGERIA 
Nouratou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en: Nouratou is a 47-year old woman. She is married to a foreign exchange agent. Nouratou has been working as a vendor of cosmetics and pharmaceutical products since 1980. She sells at the local market. Nouratou stocks up on her products in Nigeria. Nouratou is requesting her second-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and medications

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Phirum and his wife, Kong, have been married since 1994. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is married and the other three are in school. The family is living in a village along National Road Number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

The couple has been farming for almost 20 years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. They want to continue their farming business because it’s their main source of income.

Hence, Phirum is asking for another loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice and vegetable farm.

In the photo, Phirum and his wife are at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay and his wife, Chanthy, live along National Road No.1, approximately 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have five daughters.  

Chay and his wife are rice and vegetables farmers. He is applying for his second Kiva loan of 1,000 USD to make a new stairway for his house because it’s old and breaks. He will also use part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

In the photo are Chay and his wife and their young daughter.

loans.use: To make a new stairway for his house and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling by retail from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and food stuff for the food café. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and food stuff for the food café.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man, living in Nabatieh, with his wife and three children. Ali has owned a school bus since 1982, with 32 years of experience in this field. All of his customers recommend him to other customers, because of his good reputation. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to do necessary maintenance to his bus. This is Ali's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in his business and it reflected positively on his family's social and financial situation.

Ali is a good standing borrower. He also works in fixing car paint and bodywork to make extra income, to cover his family's expenses.
He hopes to open a school bus company to cover a wider region, in addition to opening a car body maintenance garage.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus.

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea (pictured here) and her husband, Than, live in a suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been married for almost ten years and have three children: a son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. 

Sokhea used to be a garment worker, but now she is a tailor. Her husband is a soldier. She is requesting her second loan of 1,000 USD to buy another kind of sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy another kind of sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and lives in Dumagoc, Pagadian City. She is married and has three children.

Virginia has an business outlet where she sells fish. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan to add additional capital to her business.

Virginia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose cooperative for 4 years.

loans.use: to add addtional capital to her existing business.

location.town: Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary (pictured above) is 29 years old, and her husband, Khemryn, is 41 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have two children: one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other one is still young. 

Theary is a garment worker, but she has stopped for a while because she is pregnant. Her husband sells rice; he buys rice from Phnom Penh market and sells them to his villagers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.use: to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn engages in cosmetics sales. She lives with her husband and four children. Jacklyn is a former OFW abroad. She has just come back to the Philippines because she got sick. Jacklyn didn't want to waste her time staying in the Philippines without any source of income.
 
Jacklyn decided to engage in a direct-selling business. She learned the business through some friends, and she has been in the business for 6 years. Jacklyn is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase eye liner, lipstick, eye brow pencil and lotions to sell on her customers. This loan will help her improve the inventory that she offers to customers. Her only difficulty is that she sells on credit, and her customers don't pay their purchases on time.

loans.use: to purchase eye liner, lipstick, eye brow and lotion to sell on her customers.

loans.name: Ayoko Akouavi

texts.fr:
Ayoko Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Ayoko Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2007. Elle vend à domicile après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. 01 personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
Ayoko Akouavi a requis son  second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des savons, des bidons d’huile, du lait et divers.
texts.en:
Ayoko Akouavi is 32 years old and single. She has been working as a retailer of general grocery products since 2007. Ayoko buys her products at the Grand Marché  in Lomé and then re-sells the goods at her home. She has one assistant. 

Ayoko is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to buy soap, barrels of oil, milk and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two baby calves and fodder.

loans.name: Tsimba

texts.en:
Tsimba is a 59 year old married father of five children. Tsimba is a livestock farmer in Mariakani. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and it is doing well. 

Tsimba has been a KADET client and this marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, Tsimba plans to purchase more goats and cattle. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. His dream is to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle.

loans.name: Pazilat

texts.ru: Пазилат 54 года, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Пазилат занимается животноводством и полеводством с 1981 года. Начав со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом, Пазилат сумела развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 4,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Пазилат имеет 4 коровы и планирует увеличить количество голов скота. Для этой цели, Пазилат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Кредит поможет получить дополнительный доход и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Pazilat is 54 years old, a widow and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1981.  Starting with 3,000 som, Pazilat was able to develop her business to yield 4,000 som (KGS) monthly.  Today, she owns 4 cows and plans to increase livestock headcount.  Pazilat requested a loan in the sum of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for this purpose.  The loan would help her to earn additional income and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory of food, bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Leangky

texts.en:
Leangky (in the photo) and her husband, Navuth, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children attend school: one is in university and another one is a cashier.

Leangky is a chef and runs a grocery store at home, while her husband is a soldier. Leangky asked for a Kiva loan once, previously, to purchase a motorbike. She is now applying for another loan of $1,000 to buy one more motorbike for her son, who is in university, to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase one more motorbike for her son, who is in university, to drive to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two milk cows and fodder

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir is a 41-year-old married man, living with his wife and four children in Nabatieh.

He works in the manufacturing sector and he specializes in making kitchen and bedroom furniture. His quality of work is very good. To keep it up and to keep up his perfect customer care, Zouheir is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a power generator necessary to do the requested work on time, since electricity is a big problem in the region.

Zouheir is an Al Majmoua borrower for the second time. His previous loan reflected positively on his business and family situations. He is sure that this loan will improve his business more and more.

loans.use: To buy a power generator

loans.name: Kimsrey

texts.en:
Kimsrey (pictured here) and her husband, Khlau, live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. Two of her sons attend school and one is still too young. 

Kimsrey is a weaver and she also sells mangoes. She buys mango under contract from villagers and when the harvest season comes, she transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Kimsrey is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials. She will also use a part of the loan to buy mango under contract to sell.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and buy mango under contract

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница города Вахдат. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Два года как занимается торговлей. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in retail sales for two years.  Mavluda is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian, 39, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Julito, a foreman, and mother to her five children. One is already working and two are in college & in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lilian operates a tailoring/sewing business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she also sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilian hopes her business grows and she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and married to Lucy who is a business lady. They have two children. He runs a retail shop, which has lasted for 11 years and right now, his monthly income is KES 9,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000, which he plans to use to add stock to the business .He plans to buy a plot with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
