loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary (in the photo) and her husband, Ret, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and just have a young son. 

Thary raise pigs at home and she assists her husband in the business. Her husband produces jars for sale. Thary is asking for a loan of $600 to buy wooden materials for her father’s carpenter business.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials for her father’s carpentry business.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan wants a loan to mulch his banana plantation. He is a Ugandan male aged 33, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a banana grower and he started with an acre of banana plantings, and now has five acres.

The responsibility to look after the family rests on him, and his dream is to buy a pickup to transport his matooke (green bananas) and educating his children.

loans.use: to mulch his banana plantation

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) and her husband, Pon, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have one daughter who is in school. 

Srey grows vegetables. Her husband is a fisherman and he also assists in his wife’s farming business. Srey is requesting her second loan of $700 to repair her kitchen where she cooks, because it’s old and broken.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 44, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo who is a driver, and mother to her three children, two are still at home while the eldest is already studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
 
Erlinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons (for other meals) when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Aside from this she also sells fruits in her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operationing her business she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes her business grows and finds a place in the local market, and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von (pictured above), 32, is a widow with one son and one daughter. She lives with her widowed mother in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Von is a garment worker and she runs a hairdressing salon when she is free. She is requesting her first Kiva loan in the amount of $500 to repair the walls of her house.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to distill alcohol for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baby's wear and accessories for resale

loans.name: Erlanbek's Group

texts.en:
Erlanbek is a member of this group. He is 31 and married to a nurse. Together they are raising a daughter and two sons. The daughter and the older son are at school, and the younger son is not yet at school because he is preschool age (under seven). 

Erlanbek works as a surgeon; three years ago he saved 12000 soms and purchased three livestock animals for breeding.  Since that time he has been breeding livestock and reselling it after fattening. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, he wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances.

loans.name: Adjo Bernadette

texts.fr:
Adjo Bernadette est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 07 ans.  
Adjo Bernadette travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2002. Elle vend à ses clients dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la mévente et le vol. 
Adjo Bernadette a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut épargner les profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo Bernadette voudrait ouvrir une grande boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo Bernadette is a 41-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first-born is 20 years old, and the last is 7. Adjo Bernadette has been working as a retailer grocer since 2002. She makes her sales out of a store. She buys the goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. At the moment, her main difficulties are a drop in sales and theft. 

Adjo Bernadette has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES to buy some grocery items. She wants to save her extra profits. In the next few years, she would like to open a large store. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 32, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a graphic artist, and is mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy liquefied petroleum gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Aside from this, she also retails electronic cellphone loads (prepaid cellphone credits) and offers direct selling products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 41,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams of having other branches someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of products needed in her business

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is 25 years old and single with 2 children aged 2 years old. He rents a house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been into video showing and a furniture business for 5 and 1 years, respectively, and he faces a challenge of power shading (blackouts) which affects the profits of his business.

His dream is to own a fully fledged workshop. Hakim needs the loan to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and rent bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and earn more profits.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ndeye Adama

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 43 ans et évolue dans le domaine de l’aviculture. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité  dans le but de diversifier ses revenus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 8 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs. L’objet du prêt est destiné a payer une commande de poussins pour les besoins de son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale et d’aider ses proches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye is 43 years old, and she lives in Senegal. She is a poultry farmer. She chose this activity out of necessity in order to diversify her income. 
She has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch for eight years. 

She is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to pay for chicks that she ordered for business purposes. This credit will allow her to improve her social standing and help her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry farming business

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brought up a daughter and a son. The daughter is a nurse and the son works in construction. Mairamkul is a nurse in the local hospital. In 2005 she saved 15,000 soms and started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns additional money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase cattle for fattening and further reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she plans to start repairing the house. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme  âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien dans une société de la place. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 02ans non scolarisé. 
Essi travaille comme coiffeuse et ajoute à cette activité la vente de charbons de bois (un combustible utilisé par les femmes togolaise) et  du mais. Elle vend à tout le monde à la maison. 
Essi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons et du maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés. 
Dans les prochaines années, Essi voudrait augmenter son niveau d’activité.
texts.en:
Essi is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a mechanic in a local company. She has a 2-year-old child, who is not in school. Essi works as a hairdresser and has included with this business the sale of charcoal (a fuel used by Togolese women) and corn. She sells to everybody from out of her house. 

Essi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal and corn. She wants to reinvest in her business by using the profits she makes. In the next few years, Essi would like to increase her level of business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз женат и у них 3 детей. Он умный и добрый человек. Абдуазиз занимается приготовлением блюд на своем местном городе. Он имеет свою столовую и у него много клиентов, которые каждый день посещает его столовую. Кроме этого он занимается купля продажей скот. Более 12 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень хороший опыт. Абдуазиз запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки скота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Abduaziz is married and has three children.  He is a smart and kind person.  Abduaziz is involved in food preparation in his local town.  He owns a cafe and has many customers, who visit his cafe every day.  Besides this, he is involved in buying and selling livestock.  He has been in this business for over 12 years and has good experience in it.  Abduaziz is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of livestock and expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée à un meunier. Elle a 2 enfants dont tous à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 7 ans
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2004. Elle vend le charbon de bois et de la bouillie à toutes les personnes à la maison. Sa difficulté principale est le retard dans la livraison des commandes.
Adjovi a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle compte épargner ces profits. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjovi voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a 36 year old woman who is married to a woodworker. She has two children, both in school. The first-born is 12, and the last is 7. Adjovi has been working as a charcoal retailer since 2004. From her home, she sells charcoal, as well as porridge, to anyone. Her main difficulty is the delay in orders being delivered. 

Adjovi has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy charcoal. She intends to save her profits. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she expects to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand and meet her customers' needs. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, fruits, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, fruits, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Ibaale Kwesiga Group

texts.en: Christine is a 50 years old, married, and has six children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main dream is to educate her children. Christine owns a retail shop which she has operated for the last two years. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations that in turn affects the demands of her clients. In the future, she hopes to trade in wholesale. Christine is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and groundnuts.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

For the past four years, he has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also operates a charcoal-selling business. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His major dream is to expand and establish a food-stall business. 

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase cereals and charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  habite au Sénégal.  Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis des années.  Elle pratique la vente de tissus et d’accessoires de femmes.  Elle a choisi son activité  par amour.  Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs dans le but de payer  la commande de marchandises qu’elle avait passé  en vue d’augmenter son stock et développer son activité de commerce. Elle envisage accroitre ses revenus et bénéfices pour mieux soutenir sa famille et prendre en charge leurs besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Ndeye lives in Senegal. She has been a retailer for several years and sells fabrics and accessories for women, a job she loves. She is a member of a branch of the UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs, so that she has the money to cover an order she has placed which will enable her to restock and develop her business activities. She expects to raise her revenues and profits and will use the extra income to contribute more to her family's social needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for her female clientele.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and married to Samuel and she supports a family of eight members. She runs a retail shop and she has been in this business for the last four years, with a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000 to add stock of sweets, washing detergents, and soft drinks for sale.

She is planing to provide the basic needs for her family with the income that she will get from the business. This is her first loan, and her dreams and hopes are to educate her children and to own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  sweets, washing detergents, and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 32, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, an electrical engineer, and she is the mother of three children. The eldest is in high school while the other two are in elementary. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Mary Grace maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon and Natasha. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits for dealers. Aside from direct selling, she also operates a small computer shop. Her regular customers are students, neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers and also to add additional stocks of school supplies. A portion of the loan will go to the maintenance of her computers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Grace hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a constructor. Together they are bringing up four sons. All except the youngest one are at school. 

Ainur is engaged in the retail trade of children’s clothing. With the profits gained from the trade, Ainur repaired the house and built a fence. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more clothes in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future, she wishes to celebrate her sons’ weddings.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 32 years old and married. She has two children, age 9 and 2, living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda.

She has been in the textile business for five years and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She faces a challenge of inadequate materials to suit the different preferences of her customers. Her dream is to trade in wholesale.

Harriet needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy (in the photo) and his wife, Sarat, have been married since 1988 and have two children one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  
Suy used to sell grocery items from home, but he quit the business. He now assists in his wife’s business. Sarat is a weaver and she so also sells mangoes in Phnom Penh market. She does not grow mango by herself, but she buys mango under contract from villagers since blooming season till the harvesting season comes. She needs to use pesticide to prevent mangoes from insects.
Hence Suy is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide to prevent mangoes from insect damage.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 39, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and mother to a child who is now studying in college. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Avelina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. 

Aside from this, she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16, 000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to have her house renovated and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials that she buys in her business.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Аъзам женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается изготовлением и продажа национальных блюд: плов, лагман (спагетти), бифштекс и других видов разных национальных блюд. Он сам является шеф-поваром в данном бизнесе. Его столовая находится на центральном рынке местного города и там много народов. Из-за этого у него много постоянных клиентов, которые часто посещает его столовую. Аъзам хотел бы получить займ для того чтобы купить основные средства и частично расширить свой ассортимент пищи.
texts.en: Azam is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is involved in preparation and sales of national food dishes, such as plov (pilaf), lagman (noodles), beefsteak and various other national dishes.  He is the chef cook in this business.  His cafe is located at the central market of his local town, where there is a lot of people.  This is why he has many loyal customers, who often visit his cafe.  Azam wants to obtain a loan in order to buy necessary ingredients and partially expand his food selection.

loans.use: to buy primary ingredients and expand food selection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware store items

loans.name: Rysbek

texts.ru: Рысбеку 41 год, женат и имеет двоих детей школьного возраста. Рысбек закончил Сельхозинститут и проработав 15 лет, обрел репутацию целеустремленного и упорного человека. В 2000 году Рысбек открыл свой собственный магазин по продаже автозапчастей, использовав стартовую сумму в 50,000 сом (KGS).  Сегодня его магазин известен среди автолюбителей качественным товаром и приемлемыми ценами. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Рысбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом на расширение ассортимента товаров. Это позволит ему увеличить товарооборот и привлечь новых клиентов. В будущем, Рысбек мечтает приобрести новый автомобиль.
texts.en: Rysbek is 41 years old, married and has two school-age children.  He graduated from the Agricultural Institute and, having worked for 15 years, gained a reputation of a goal-oriented and persistent person.  In 2000, using a starting sum of 50,000 som (KGS), Rysbek opened his own store, where he sells auto parts.   Today, his store is known among motorists for its quality goods and affordable prices.  In order to further expand his business, Rysbek requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to broaden his merchandise selection.  This would let him increase goods turnover and attract new customers.  In the duture, Rysbek dreams of buying a new car.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour, beans and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai is a 49-year-old widowed woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Minh City. 

Gai operates a general store selling household necessities such as toiletries, brooms, water containers and other small personal-use items. Her store is located in front of her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and people living in the local community.

Gai would like to get a loan to buy coal and a greater quantity and range of toiletries to sell in her store to better meet the needs of her customers.

She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy coal and a greater quantity and range of toiletries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rimando

texts.en:
This is Rimando, 54, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Elizabeth, the mother of their children. Rimando, together with his wife and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rimando operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories, and others of the like. Rimando's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rimando hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials for his business.

loans.name: Nhon

texts.en:
Nhon is a 41-year-old married woman with a son. She and her husband have been raising dairy cows for six years. Nhon lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhon would like to take out a loan to buy more cows and animal feed to increase the size of her business. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the education costs of her child.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows and cow fodder.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. She has two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and the sons are at school. In order to earn money for their livelihood, she sells vegetables, potatoes, onions, carrot and oil. She has been in this business for twenty years; with the profits gained from the trade she repaired the house, purchased household furniture, etc. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more vegetables to sell. In the future Gulnara wishes to improve the family’s welfare and to build a house for their sons. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is a 56-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband works as a farmer. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, she has run a food stall T. cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan T. buy new furniture, bowls and chopsticks and better quality food and beverages T. provide T. her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her T. improve her living conditions and allow her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children.  She rears pigs so as to earn a living for her family.  She has been farming for three years.  She also owns a grocery shop which earns her extra income.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she was able to start up the grocery shop.  In return, she made enough savings from her business and bought pigs. 

Jenifer hopes to expand her farm in the future.  She has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 55 years old and is married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Le and her husband earn money by running a general store, which is located in front of their house. They started this business over six years ago. Le intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products, such as beverages, milk, drinking water tanks and confectionery to sell in her store.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy beverages, milk, drinking water tanks and confectionery in bulk.

loans.name: Michgona

texts.ru: Мичгона проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Она более семи лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду и ткани. Кредит берет для покупки женской одежды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Michgona lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 21 years old, single and lives together with her parents.  She has been involved in retail sales for over seven years.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells children's clothing and fabrics.  Michgona is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's clothing in order to expand her merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a determined businesswoman aged 35. She is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last three years, she has been managing a grocery shop to earn a living. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. Her dream is to buy  a lorry for transporting fruits to other markets. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 42 years old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Yen and her husband earn money by running a general store from the door of their house. They started this business nine years ago.

Yen requires a loan to expand her business by purchasing many kinds of products, such as toothpaste, shampoo and personal sanitary items to stock her store. She hopes that this will enabL. her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enabL. her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, shampoo, and personal sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala  is 30, and she is engaged in poultry breeding. Poultry is very popular among Azerbaijani people and most of the everyday meals are made of chicken or turkey. She has 4 years of experience in this field and her father, who is helping her now, was the one who brought her the idea of starting the business. Now her monthly income is 200 USD and she is on the way to increasing it.

 Kamala has a lot of customers and their demand is rising very fast. Kamala needs additional financial support to cover this high market demand. For this purpose she applied for 1100 AZN. She will use the loan to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys to cover market demand.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking businessman aged 33. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last four years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also does dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Садулло целеустремленный и честный человек. Он занимается перевозкой пассажиров на местном города. Он относятся со своими клиентами добро и мягко. Он начинал данный бизнес 7 лет назад с арендованным автомобилям. Постепенно зарабатывая денег, он купил себе автомобиль марки «Газель-2705». Садулло хотел бы получить займ для установки газового оборудования и покупка автошин в зимний период.
texts.en: Sadullo is a purposeful and honest man. He transports passengers around local towns. He treats his customers kindly and gently. He started his business seven years ago with a rented vehicle. Step by step by earning money he bought himself a car of brand Gazel-2705. Sadullo wants to get a loan to install gas equipment and to buy tires for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car and to install gas equipment

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
This is Anh, 41, a resident of H. Chi Minh City. She is married with two sons. 

Anh and her husband operate a general store. Their store sells many kinds of household products to the people in her community, such as instant noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks and confectionery. To help her to expand her business, Anh would like a loan to buy toiletries and beverages to expand the quantity and range of products sold by her store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business and she hopes that this will enable her to better provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy toiletries and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Karamatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Karamatkhon is a member of this group. She is 60 and sadly, she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The sons work in Russia and the daughter works as a secretary. In order to earn money to meet her daily needs Karamatkhon sews Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. In this way she earns about 800 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to pay the constructors, whom she is going to hire to repair her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay constructors for house repair.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 36, is married and earns a living to support her family by sewing hats. Her husband is also involved in this business. She lives with their two daughters and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuong and her husband started the business eight years ago. Phuong would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to buy fabric and good materials that will enable her to make better quality hats for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials to make better quality hats to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 49, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, an employee, and mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gloria oversees operations of their truck rental business. They have two trucks that they offer to be rented for cargo or for people who need a truck when transferring household materials to other places. They provide their services within the city & nearby provinces. Aside from this she also earns other income from the renters who occupy a small store beside her house. She earns a minimum of 3600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for maintenance of her trucks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gloria hopes to acquire another truck and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their truck.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old and single. He has been a mechanic for 12 years. Since he joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented. His desire is to own a big garage in five years. Through Faulu Kenya he has also managed to grow his business.
Charles has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a compressor machine.

loans.use: to buy a compressor machine.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 40 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.
Quyen and her husband earn money by sewing hats at their house. Quyen intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production. She hopes that her business runs smoothly, and that this will help to improve her family's living conditions and give her the ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials to increase her production of hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase working tools and special stone for making gravestones.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is 41 years old and is the mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 
My and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over a year. They sell noodles and many kinds of dishes for vegetarians. 
My is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase more types of food to sell. She hopes this will help her earn more money so she can reinvest in her current business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and more types of food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Nogaye est une vendeuse de tissus et accessoire de femmes. Elle vit au Sénégal. C’est une jeune femme de 27 ans qui évolue dans le commerce depuis quelques années. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité  dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets  de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 75 000 prévu pour l’achat de tissus  destinés a renforcer son stock. Son objectif est de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices et augmenter le soutien qu’il apporte a ses parents.
texts.en: Nogaye is 27 years old and lives in Senegal. She has been earning a living as a trader for several years and sells fabrics and accessories for women. She is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches and is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs in order to restock on fabric so that she can meet growing customer demand. This loan should allow her to increase her profits and the amount of financial support she can give to her parents.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 45 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married and has two children.
Nguyet and her husband run a business selling food from a stall in a local market. They sell many kinds of food, including rice cakes, beansprouts and fresh and dried noodles. 
Nguyet requires a loan to increase the turnover of her business by purchasing a greater range of basic foods. In this way she will be able to serve her existing customers better and attract new customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh is 47 years old and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have a business selling pork, which they started ten years ago. 
Because of capital shortage, Xinh often has to buy pork in smaller quantities at higher prices. She would like to take a loan that will help her to expand her business and buy larger quantities of pork at cheaper prices. As a result, she hopes to increase her family's income and create better opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy pork for resale.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Suru Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO SURU est composé de trois personnes qui vendent ensemble dans le même marché. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie Akoua est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mélanie Akoua est âgée de 47 ans et est une veuve qui vit seule. Mélanie Akoua a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois restent encore à sa charge. Mélanie Akoua n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et nourrir ses enfants, Mélanie Akoua vend des produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Mélanie Akoua s'approvisionne au Bénin. Mélanie Akoua exerce cette activité depuis six ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Mélanie Akoua sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO SURU.
texts.en:
The group GBEDOKPO SURU is comprised of three persons who are sellers together at the same market. This is the first time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, by the name of Mélanie Akoua, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and a widow who lives alone. She has four children, all in school. 

Mélanie Akoua never attended school. To support herself and make sure her children are fed, she sells a variety of goods (canned foods, soaps, cassava flour, etc.) in a market in Benin. Her supplies come from Benin. She has been in this business for six years. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her revenues, Mélanie Akoua and the other members of the group GBEDOKPO SURU are requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, and cassava flour

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan is a 55-year-old woman who lives with her daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. For ten years, Thuan has operated a business selling underclothes from a small stall at an outdoor market. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by purchasing women’s clothes and men’s t-shirts to sell. She hopes that this will help her to increase her income and enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Behzod

texts.ru: Бехзод умный и добросовестный муж. Он занимается услугой перевозкой пассажиров на местном городе. Он еще предоставляет услуги перевозкой молодожены для свадебных мероприятий и загса. Более 2 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и от этого получает хороший доход. Его автомобиль находиться в хорошем состояние, и этот бизнес является единственным источником его дохода. Бехзод хотел бы получить займ для покупки запчастей и автошин для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Behzod is a smart and conscientious husband.  He is involved in providing passenger transportation services in his local town.  He also provides transportation services for newlyweds for wedding events and registry office.  He has been in this business for two years and earns a good income from it.  His car is in good condition, and this business is his sole source of income.  Behzod wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of auto parts and tires for this car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and tires

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 53 years old and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuong earns an income to support her family by running a business selling beef and beef products. Phuong has been doing this for fifteen years. 

Phuong would like to borrow to increase her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of beef and beef products to attract more customers. She hopes that will help her to increase her family income and cover the education costs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim  is 24, a very young and ambitious man who is already succeeding in his business. Ibrahim sells different kinds of food products in his father's shop. He continues the family business and his father is teaching him best practices. 

Ibrahim is very friendly and a polite gentlemen and this is makes his business very attractive to many customers.   His monthly income generated from his shop is 200 USD. Ibrahim would like to expand his business and for this purpose he applied for 1200 AZN.   He hopes to improve living conditions for his family. He has two daughters.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to increase income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks and coffee to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Ayidekon Group

texts.fr: AYIDEKON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Ayaba Angeline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Marcel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayaba Angeline assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Ayaba Angeline a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans, dans le but de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Ayaba Angeline vend des tissus, des sacs et des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Ayaba Angeline achète ses produits au Togo et aussi au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Ayaba Angeline et les autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AYIDEKON is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Ayaba Angeline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 58 years old and married to Marcel. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Ayaba Angeline and her husband jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Ayaba Angeline halted her studies in middle school. For nearly five years, with the goal of responding better to the needs of her children, she has been selling fabrics, bags, and used clothing at a market in Benin. She buys her goods in Togo and also in Benin. 

This is the second time that Ayaba Angeline and the other members of the group AYIDEKON have requested financial support from ALIDé to bolster their working capital and their business, as well as to respond better to customer requirements. The previous loan has indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, bags, and used clothing

loans.name: Rakhmat

texts.ru: Рахмат  - 49-летний фермер, живущий в г.Нарын (север Кыргызстана). Женат и воспитывает сына Рахманкула. Рахмат проработал столяром-плотником 25 лет и известен своим  серьезным подходом к любому делу и исполнительностью. В 1986 году, в поисках дополнительного источника существования для своей семьи, Рахмат начал свой бизнес в разведении  и продаже скота. Благодаря упорству Рахмата, стартовый капитал в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS)  перерос в хозяйство с численностью в 8 голов овец, 3 головы коз и одной коровы. За счет прибыли от хозяйства, Рахмат приобрел бытовую технику для семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахмат обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На доходы от кредита в этом году Рахмат планирует купить компьютер для сына, а в будущем – увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Rakhmat is a 49-year-old farmer from the town of Naryn (northern Kyrgyzstan).  He is married and is raising a son, Rahmankul.  Rakhmat spent 25 years working as a carpenter-joiner and is known for his serious approach to any business and for his diligence.  In search of an additional source of income for his family, Rakhmat started his own business of breeding and selling livestock in 1986.  Thanks to Rakhmat's persistence, the starting capital in the sum of 8,000 som (KGS) has grown into a business with 8 sheep, 3 goats and one cow.  Rakhmat purchased household applicances for his family by using profits from this business.  In order to further develop his business, Rakhmat requesting a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  Rakhmat plans to use the income from the loan this year to purchase a computer for his son and increase livestock quantity in the future.

loans.use: to further develop his business

loans.name: Zuurakan's Group

texts.en:
Zuurakan is the leader of this group. She is 56 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and three daughters, and all the children are; either employed or engaged in farming. At the moment Zuurakan is engaged in livestock breeding; she resells livestock after fattening. In this way she earns about 700 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase three sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future Zuurakan wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Mahouvivi Group

texts.fr: MAHOUVIVI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Pascaline. Les membres du groupe vendent ensemble dans le même marché au Bénin. Pascaline est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Hervé. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Pascaline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Afin de satisfaire à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Pascaline vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, oignons, ails, etc.) et des épices. A côté de cela Pascaline vend des perles. Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Pascaline s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Pascaline et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUVIVI sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaires et leur revenu.
texts.en:
MAHOUVIVI is a group composed of three persons whose representative is named Pascaline (the one with the hand raised in the photo). Together, the group members are sellers at the same market in Benin. Pascaline is 36 years old and married to Hervé. They have four children, all in school and in their care. Pascaline lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly meet for the various family needs. 

Pascaline halted her studies in middle school. In order to support herself and her children, she sells various goods (pasta, onions, garlic, etc.) and spices. Aside from this, she sells beads. She has been in this business for three years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Pascaline and the other members of the group MAHOUVIVI have requested a loan from ALIDé to expand their business and to increase their sales and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy boxes of pasta, baskets of onions, and sacks of garlic

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 63 years old, married, and has eight children.  To earn a living, he practices dairy farming.  He has been in the business for twenty years.    He also does horticultural farming to supplement his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business with his previous loans.

George hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 39-year-old beautician, who lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 
Trang runs a beauty shop from her house. She began working in this profession two years ago.
Trang is requesting a loan to buy some hairdriers, steamers and stretching machines and other basic supplies for her beauty shop. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy some hairdriers, steamers and stretching machines and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Wanyinan-Agblangandan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alaba Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  Alaba Josephine est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Alaba Josephine et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Alaba Josephine vend des plastiques, des glaciaires et des mêches. Alaba Josephine s'approvisionne au Nigéria État voisin du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur  clientèle, Alaba Josephine et les autres membres du groupe  WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN sollicitent pour une troisième fois,l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN is comprised of three persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Alaba Josephine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is married to Jean. They have three children, all in school and in their care. The family lives together in the same house. 

Alaba Josephine and her husband jointly provide for the household. To do so, she sells plastic ware, insulated containers (coolers), and hair extensions. Her supplies come from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the needs of their customers, Alaba Josephine and the other members of the group WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN are requesting financial support from ALIDé. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy plasticware, insulated containers, and hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more breeding stock.

loans.name: Mbugua

texts.en: Mbugua is a 53-year-old hardworking married businessman. For over three years, he has been growing flowers and selling seedling flowers to earn a living. He also does dairy farming for more income generation. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Vaisidin

texts.ru: Вайсидин женат и любящий отец 5 детей. Он добросовестный и умный человек. Он занимается перевозка грузов, а также продажа сельскохозяйственных культур. Вайсидин хочет содержит свою в хороших состояниях жизни и устроит своих детей в институтах. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Вайсидин хотел бы получить займ для покупки овощей для продажи и ремонт грузовика. Он заранее хочет благодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и доброты.
texts.en: Vaisidin is a married and loving father of five children.  He is a conscientious and smart person.  He is involved in transporting heavy loads and also in selling agricultural crops.  Vaisidin wants to provide a good quality of life for his family and place his children to universities.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Vaisidin wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of vegetables for sale and for repairs to his truck.  He thanks all creditors in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and repair his truck

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin, 32, is married and has two children. He works in the agricultural industry. Five years ago he decided to cultivate the land he owned. He did so to generate more income so he could support his family. Shahin grows wheat, corn, fruits and vegetables, which he carefully tends so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy seed and organic fertilizer that will enable him to improve his production yield. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.
Shahin enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans so he can improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth and an extra sewing machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking businessman. He is 27, married and blessed with one child. For the last six years, he has been doing carpentry to earn a living. He mainly makes coffins. He has retained his business because of his hard work. In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur libasse habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié et gère une agence d’assurance dans la localité ou il vit. Parallèlement  avec sa profession qu’il exerce depuis 5 ans, il pratique aussi l’élevage de moutons.  Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de l’achat de nouvelles têtes  qu’il compte engraisser pour les revendre pour la fête  de Tabaski prochaine. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité secondaire pour mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Libasse is 35 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married, and for the last 5 years, he has managed an insurance agency in the neighborhood where he lives. At the same time, he raises sheep. He has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since 2003. Libasse is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to buy more animals that he plans to fatten for re-sale at the next Tabaski festival. This loan will allow him to obtain more profit from his secondary activity, to better meet his social expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep to re-sell at the Tabaski festival

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, one girl and three boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Saumu operates a clothes sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers. Saumu dreams of educating her children and improving her living standards. 
With her 30,000 KES loan, Saumu wants to purchase bundles of clothes and dress materials for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and dress materials for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with six children, four girls and two boys, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  
For the past two years, Rose has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rose dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards in the future.
With this loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Холмат умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 5 детей. С детства он интересовался скотоводством. Уже более 8 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень богатый опыт. Он покупает скот из других районов, а затем продает их на местном рынке. Этот бизнес является единственным источникам дохода в его семье, и он хочет, расширить этот бизнес, и хочет получить максимальный прибыль. Холмат хотел бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота.
texts.en: Kholmat is a smart and conscientious person.  He is married and is a father of five children.  He has been interested in animal husbandry since childhood.  Kholmat has been involved in this business for over 8 years and has a rich experience in it.  He buys livestock from other districts and sells it at the local market.  This business is his family's only source of income, and he wants to expand this business and maximize his profits.  Kholmat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a hardworking businesswoman. She is 23, married and blessed with one child. 
For the last two years, Ann has been managing a grocery store to earn a living. She has grown her business with her previous loans from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Ann is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy potatoes and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a single man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, Juma has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. Juma dreams of succeeding in business and living a better life. 
With this loan of 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents. He decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is married and has four children, three boys and one girl. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past eight years, she has made a living by running a restaurant, serving mostly neighbors and students who attend a nearby school. Her biggest challenge is competition from other restaurants, but she dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living standards. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy utensils and furniture that will allow her customers to eat in greater comfort. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils and furniture for a restaurant.

loans.name: Valéri

texts.fr:
Célibataire sans enfants, Valérie vit en location à Cotonou. 
Elle commercialise des articles communément appelé divers et constitués des conserves, de piles, et tous autres articles. Elle mène son activité génératrice de revenus dans un des petits marchés de quartier situé dans la ville de Cotonou. Elle effectue ses achats près des grossistes au marché international du Bénin. Sa clientèle est constituée prioritairement des usagers du marché. 
Elle a sollicité et obtenu le renouvellement de son prêt à FINADEV afin de renforcer sa capacité financière à faire face aux demandes croissantes de sa clientèle. Ce fonds injecté dans l'activité et les revenus supplémentaires qui en découleront pourront l'aider à une meilleure prise charge de ses besoins personnels et pour améliorer son cadre de vie
texts.en:
Valerie is single and doesn’t have any children. She rents a dwelling in Cotonou.

She sells various items such as canned goods, batteries, and other merchandise. She runs her business at one of the small neighborhood markets in Cotonou. She buys her stock from wholesalers at the international market of Benin. Her clientele consists primarily of market goers.

She obtained a loan renewal with FINADEV to strengthen her working capital in order to meet increasing customer demand. The additional revenue earned through this new funding will allow her to better support herself and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married and has six children, four boys and two girls. Four of her children attend school while the other two have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, she has made a living by selling green groceries to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the high cost of transportation, but she dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living standards. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy potatoes, tomatoes and green vegetables to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to secure loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 32 years old, married and has two children. For the last eight years, he has made a living by proving tailoring services. He has made good use of his Faulu Kenya membership to acquire many important business skills, and currently employes two people. He is applying for a loan for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for his business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: Madame Faty  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée  et  âgée de 56 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et vends des tissus et autres articles divers. C’est depuis le bas âge  qu’elle a commencé a exercer le petit commerce. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2000. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et autres articles divers en vue d’élargir son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra de diversifier son offre de marchandises  et répondre à la demande croissante de la clientèle de veille de fête  de Tabaski.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Faty is 56 years old, married and lives in Senegal. She has been developing a retail business for the past 10 years and sells fabric and other miscellaneous products. She was quite young when she started out. 

A member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2000, Faty is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy fabric and other products so that she can expand her business. This loan will allow her to offer a diverse range of items and to meet her customers' demands as the Tabaski festival approaches.  Increased profit will allow her to better meet her social expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other merchandise for re-sale.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en: Bai is the single mother of three children, two of whom attend school while her third is too young to go. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past seven years, she has made a living by running a restaurant that serves people who live in her area. Her main challenge is late payments by creditors and the fact that her business is seasonal. But she works hard because she dreams of being able to educate her children and improve her family's living standards. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy utensils and food, including wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and food for a restaurant.

loans.name: Addidas Group

texts.en: Sharifa is in her mid-40s, married and has four children, three of whom attend school. For the last 20 years, she has earned a living by running a studio where she shows movies. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and makes a good monthly profit. She is applying for her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first one to buy a generator and electric wiring for her studio. She has repaid that loan fully and on time, and plans to use the new one to buy a computer and improve her studio. She also leads this loan group, which is also called "Sharifa." It has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to use in her studio.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56 year-old married man and a father of four children between 28 and 17 years old.  Ali runs a retail shop in Mariakani. He has been in this business for the last four years.

 Ali has been a KADET client, and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan Ali plans to add more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize meal, salt and tea leaves into his shop. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.
His dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: add more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize meal, salt and tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate his restaurant.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He owns rental houses which earn him a living.  He also rears pigs to supplement his income.
