Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business because he has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Francis has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a married mother of two children. She earns a living running a general store.

Thuy would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries for selling

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is a 57-year-old widowed woman with three sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phi earns an income to support her family by running a food stall in front of her house. She has been running her business for the past 13 years.

Phi would like to receive a loan to purchase furniture, bowls, plates, and chopsticks, as well as more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: To buy furniture, bowls, plates, chopsticks and more food to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with five school-going children: three girls and two boys. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasiti dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Margaret Waithira

texts.en: Margaret is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 7 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be outgoing and cheerful. She operates a mobile phones accessories sales business where she sells airtime and mobile phone chargers. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at Barisheba in Mombasa. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power rationing. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to increase her stock of mobile phones accessories. Her business goal is to grow the business and diversify into other types of businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to comfortably educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones accesssories

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Humphrey, who is in his early 30s is married with a very young son.  He has been selling charcoal for two years now.  He works from 6 a.m to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for increasing his stock of charcoal. His dream is to one day be able to open a food cafe.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mchicha" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Khuong

texts.en:
Khuong, 42, is the father of two daughters. Together with his wife and children, Khuong lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income from selling fruit from their streetside stall. He began this business 15 years ago.

Every morning they buy common seasonal fruit such as plums, pineapples, watermelons, cherries, and bananas to sell in their stall. Khuong would like a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit so that he can attract more customers. 

He hopes that, through the loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 45 years old, married with three children between 18 and 15 years. His primary business is poultry-keeping, besides having a workshop. He has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his third loan through KADET. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy more layers. Anticipated profits will be used repay the loan and to pay school fees for his children. 


His dream is to build his own house.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more layer hens.

loans.name: Kasi Mpya Group

texts.en:
Daudi, who is his mid 20s, is married with a small child.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for one year now.  He works from 10 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a piece of land and started to build a small two-roomed house. He also increased the clothes sales and has paid back both his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock in second-hand clothes and to finish building his small house. His dream is to one day be able to take his child to good standard schools.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kasi Mpya" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase  his stock in second-hand clothes and to finish building his small house.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur  Alioune habite au Sénégal. Il  est marié et  âgé de 57 ans. C’est un retraité qui s’adonne à la vente de thé dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettront de compléter  sa pension  de retraite et couvrir ses charges. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 8 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour son approvisionnement en thé  ce qui l’aidera a  satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle  pour ce produits actuellement très consommé au Sénégal. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses  bénéfices  pour mieux se prendre en charge et  soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune lives in Senegal. He is married, 57 years old, and a retiree who is very devoted to selling tea. His goal is to acquire the revenues enabling him to round out his retirement pension and to cover this expenses. 

Mr. Alioune has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches for eight years. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for a supply of tea, which will help him to meet the burgeoning demand of his customers for this product that is currently consumed a great deal in Senegal. This financing will allow him to increase his profits in order to support himself better, as well as those near and dear to him.

loans.use: to buy tea to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 29 years old and a married lady. She runs a beauty salon in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. 

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to add more stock of "hair food", relaxer, shampoo and buy a dryer. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of "hair food", relaxer, shampoo and buy a dryer.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 24-year-old married lady. She runs a poultry business in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last two years. She has been a KADET client for quite some time and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. 

With this loan she plans to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. 

Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en: Nahashon is a hardworking businessman aged 51. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, he has been doing dairy farming to earn a living. He also operates a retail shop so as to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years old, married to Alice Judith, and he supports a family of three people. He sells charcoal and he has been in business two years. His monthly income from the business is KES 15,000.


This is his second loan with KADET. He repaid his earlier loan successfully. He will use the loan to add more charcoal to the business. He plans to purchase a "matatu" (mini-bus) with the anticipated profit from the business. His dream and hope is to venture into the transport business.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal to his business.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 50 years old, married and mother of six children aged between 25 and 14 years old. Rahab sells charcoal in Mariakani. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This is her fourth loan with KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. With this loan she plans to purchase more bags of charcoal. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is aged 49 and has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya for the last 10 years. He is married with six children four of whom are already schooling. He works as a security guard in the local market. His farm produces milk, sugarcane and eggs.

Alfred has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying more poultry and building a bigger and better poultry unit for the increased number. He adds that he has had good experience in the business and the loan will help improve his family's livelihood.

He reiterates that lack of finance coupled with animal diseases are the major challenges both in dairy and poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock for sale

loans.name: Cayo Hernan

texts.es:
El Señor Cayo tiene de 52 años de edad es separado, el matrimonio tuvo tres hijos de los cuales uno vive en el exterior trabajando y sus otros dos hijos, el de 19 años está en el probatorio para la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la universidad Nacional y la otra hija de 15 años esta cursando el primer año de la escolar media, ambos viven con su madre, pero siempre apoyado económicamente por el señor Cayo.  Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios y que en el futuro sean buenos profesionales y estén preparados para enfrentar la vida, que cada vez está más complicada.
El señor Cayo se dedica al negocio de ventas de artículos electrónicos desde hace 11 años. Empezó con un pequeño capital y con el correr del tiempo gracias a los buenos clientes que tiene sus ingresos aumento considerablemente y por ende tambien su negocio.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de artículos para su negocio como ser accesorios, celulares, antena satelital, LCD, que le deja buen margen de  ganancias y al mismo tiempo cumple con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Señor Cayo is 52 years old.  He is separated from his wife and has three children from the marriage, one of whom is living and working abroad.  With the other two, his19-year-old son is in the probationary period for a degree in Business Administration at the National University, and his 15-year-old daughter is in her first year at middle school.  Both live with their mother, but are always supported financially by Señor Cayo.  

His dream is for his children to complete their university studies and in the future that they become good professionals and be prepared to face life, which each day gets more complicated.

Señor Cayo has had a business selling electronic items for 11 years.  He began with a small amount of capital and over time. thanks to his good customers, his income has grown considerably and so has his business.

He is requesting this loan to buy items for his business such as accessories, cellphones, satellite antennae and LCDs, which bring in a good margin, and at the same time will fill the orders he has received.

loans.use: to buy accessories, cell-phones, satellite antennae, and LCDs.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with six children, three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past two years, she has operated a local brew selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase coconuts to make a local brew for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts to make a local brew for sale.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman with four boys and three girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years, she has operated a milk selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality in her business. She dreams of educating her children in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase containers of milk and sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase containers of milk and sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an order of merchandise that was already delivered to her by her supplier

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 35 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan and her husband earn money by cooking and selling sweet soup.  She intends to use her loan to buy ingredients and different types of beans, such as soya beans and green beans, to cook a variety of sweet soups.  Doing so will help Ngan attract more clients and increase her earnings. 

She hopes that this will help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and beans to make sweet soup for selling.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking 33 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last four years, he has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living. He has worked hard to grow his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy seats.

loans.use: To buy seats

loans.name: Wicliff

texts.en:
Wicliff is a forty-three year old married man with thirteen children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Wicliff has been a commercial farmer for twenty years, who started out by growing maize and later diversified to coffee and bananas.

His hardships are price fluctuations, high transport costs and climatic changes.  Despite his challenges, his vision is to have a model farm, a poverty free home and educated children.

loans.use: To weed, mulch and buy manure

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 35-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh city with his children and wife. 

Dung runs a motorcycle repair business, which he has run for eight years. He would like to take out a loan to expand his business by purchasing more equipment and spare-parts to serve a larger number of customers. 

He hopes that through the loan his business will be able to generate more income and enable him to improve his family's living conditions and put aside savings for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and spare-parts to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 30, is a hardworking business woman.  She is married and blessed with a one-year-old child.

For the last three years, she has managed a salon to raise money to bring up her family. 

In the next five years, Margaret wants to expand her business. Her dream is to own a hair dressing school. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drier and braids.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier and braids.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with six children, two boys and four girls, all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en: Kasimu is a 50-year-old married man with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that sells general merchandise and he has operated it for 24 years. His main dream is to become a wholesaler and to educate his children up to the University level. Kasimu needs the loan to buy biscuits, paraffin and cooking oil for sell.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, paraffin and cooking oil  for sale.

loans.name: Nzai

texts.en:
Nzai is a married man with eight children: six boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past 10 years, he has operated a butcher shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of his products spoiling,  leading to losses. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase six goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase six goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy weaves and hair braids

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent, a 39-year-old married man with eight children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been growing tomatoes, bananas and eggplant for the past 18 years, having started his agricultural pursuits by growing maize on a small scale and later diversifying into commercial farming of these products. His business hardships include price fluctuations, climate changes and inflation, and his vision is to have a well-established farm and an educated family.

Vicent is requesting the loan to pay workers who have to prune, weed, and mulch his farm, and to buy manure.

loans.use: to pay workers who have to prune, weed, and mulch, and to buy manure for the farm.

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Renatha is in her mid 30s, married and has two children, one of whom attends school. She has been running a charcoal business for one year.  She works from 7 a.m to 4.30 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Renatha is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to  be able to build her own house.

Renatha will share this loan with her loan group Kinole, which has a total of 18 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu is a 57 years old, married, and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past six years, Tu has been making an income to support her family by selling basic foods and household necessities from her general store. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of foods and goods to sell to her customers in her store. She hopes that this will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses. Tu hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of basic foods and household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alii

texts.en:
Ali is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, Ali has operated a spare parts business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he sells petrol which contributes to his income. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Ali dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Ali is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which he will use to purchase petrol for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for resale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for five years. Alex started with 100,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuations and his dream is to own a wholesale shop in addition to educating his children. Alex is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to  purchase sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a hardworking businesswoman who is 23 years old. She is married and has two children. For the last six years, she has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living. She gives gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping her to grow her business.  Currently, she has employed one person in her business.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy ingredients such as beans and rice.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice and beans

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en: Amisi is a 34-year-old single mother of three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the children solely rests on her and her dream is to educate her children. She has been dealing in second hand clothes for five years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is setting up another boutique in town. Amisi needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Thuong is a 30-year-old married woman with two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. They live in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thuong earns an income by running a grocery stall on the side of a street. She has been in this business for five years. 

Thuong intends to take a loan to purchase a larger quantity of vegetables to prepare and sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking business-lady aged 59 and has three children. For the last 10 years she has been growing spinach and cone flowers to support her family. She also owns rental houses which generate more income for her family. She has grown her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya allowing her to improve her living standards.  She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy spinach seedlings.

loans.use: to buy spinach seedlings.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a thirty-five year-old married woman with three children and  she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for five years. She was formerly employed but now is self employed. Her hardship is increased by fees for a trading license. Her vision is a big salon plus educated children. Milly needs the loan to buy cosmetics, hair weaves and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair weaves and pay school fees.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
La Victoria se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Presidenta, la Señora Rosalina. Ella contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el segundo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Una de las miembros del grupo es la señora Limpia, ella es modista, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya un tiempo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, pues ella es una señora muy amable y con muy buen trabajo. Una de sus metas es poder tener un taller grande, donde pueda realizar todas sus costuras. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que desea darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y otros insumos necesarios para el abastecimiento de su taller de costura. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The excellent group, La Victoria, is made up of women from Itá, The current president, Rosalina, learned about the program that the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) has from a consultant in one of the committee's weekly meetings .  Once she found out about the program, she succeeded in getting 16 women together and they are happily working as a group on their second loan cycle in the program.  All are in businesses to earn money.  They support each other to achieve the goals that they all have in common.

One of the members is Limpia.  She has been a seamstress for some time now.  She says that she has many customers since she is very friendly and does very good work.  One of her goals is to have a bigger workshop where she can do all types of sewing.  She says that what she does is for the good of her family since she wants to give them a better standard of living.

Limpia is requesting the loan to buy materials, thread, needles and other necessary items to supply her sewing workshop.  She has her hopes on the loan since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed cotton.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a business woman aged 41. She is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last 15 years she has been practicing dairy farming and poultry rearing to earn a living. She also grows tea leaves. She has grown her business because of her hard work.  In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Kabaka 11 Group

texts.en: Eliza is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in bar business for two years. She started with 50,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is price fluctuations and her visions are a well-established bar and educating her children. Eliza needs a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Kuña Kyre`y se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de una comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades como son las ventas y cría de animales, ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Actualmente se encuentra integrado por 10 mujeres de la zona.
Una de las miembros es la señora Delia, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales, de lo cual obtiene los medios necesarios para poder solventar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar. Comenta que todo el arduo trabajo que realiza con los animales es por su familia, ya que desea darles lo mínimo para asegurarles un estilo de vida digno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales pequeños, como así también de alimentos para los mismos. Está agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Kuña Kyre`y" was formed when a number of neighbors from a community in the city of Santani got together.  All of the members of this group are working on their businesses, including retail sales and animal husbandry.  They have formed a tightly knit group that is able to  carry out joint activities that strengthen their partnership.  The group is currently composed of 10 members who are all women from the neighborhood.

One of the members is Delia.  She has a business raising and selling animals, and through this business she obtains the means to pay for the daily  expenses of her household.  She comments that all of the hard work she does with her animals is for her family, because she wants to at least provide the minimum that is required to assure them a decent life.

She requests a loan to buy young animals, and also animal feed.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that is being provided to her, since this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and later sell, and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for 14 years. She started with 600,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the different tastes of her customers and her visions are a bigger textile shop and educating her children. Jackline needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a 48-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him and his dream is to educate his children up to higher levels of education. He has been in farming for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land where he has a banana plantation. His hardship is the dry seasons, which lead to low output and his visions are having high yields and buying more land. Geoffrey needs the loan to buy beans, maize, cotton and pineapples to plant.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, cotton and pineapples to plant

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is 51 years old, married to Onesmus Mochama and together they have four children. Three of the children are already in college and one has completed. Her primary business is farming at Mwiki. She has been in the business for the past four years. Her monthly income is 6,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to purchase maize seeds and other farm implements. 

The anticipated profit will help her educate her children. Her hopes are to ensure all their children have completed their education through college.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and other farm implements

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Empathy group.  She joined the group as a business lady who runs a cafeteria.  Her business has been running for 11 years.  She has retained her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. 

Josephine hopes to expand her business so that she can get enough capital to build rental houses within five years.  She has requested 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils for serving food in her cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Feliz

texts.en:
Felix is 31 years old and single.  He has been running a laundry for the last three years, making a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He has been loaned KES 20,000, which he will use to buy detergents, soaps and basins at wholesale.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to expand his business and save for future investments. He hopes to buy his own washing machine in the near future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps and basins at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bread, tea leaves and match boxes tosell.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 51 years old, is married, and has eight children. He does bicycle repairs to earn a living. He has operated this business for three years and has employed two people. He also works as a security guard. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and learned how to save his money.

Within five years, Alphonce wants to start selling vehicle spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 39,000 Kenya shillings to buy bicycle spare parts and bicycle pressure pump.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and bicycle pressure pump

loans.name: Alogo Group

texts.fr: ALOGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe,Irène(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin.Irène est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.Irène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison.Irène n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Irène mène comme activité la vente des condiments de sauce.Irène s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Irène et les autres membres du groupe ALOGO sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
ALOGO is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Irène, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old, lives in a city in Benin, and is married to a furniture maker by the name of Albert. They have four children, all in school and in their care. Irène lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

Irène never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has a business selling condiments for making sauces. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. 

This is the first time that Irène and the other members of the group ALOGO have requested financial support from ALIDé to bolster their working capital and their business, as well as to respond better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 29-year-old, married man with two children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop—a business he has run for 5 years. In the future, he hopes to turn his shop into wholesale. Moses needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, and millet flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo, sus cuatro hijos de 8, 12, 11 y 14 años; ellos trabajan todos los días vendiendo frutas y verduras en los municipios cercanos, en su vehículo, recorriendo casi toda la zona,  de esta manera ellos logran vender sus verduras y proveer para sus hijos la alimentación.
Actualmente requieren de un préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras frescas: manzanas, naranjas, bananas, papas, tomates, estos productos para el negocio y además necesitan remodelar el vehículo para que su venta este mejor acomodada.
Su objetivo es seguir conquistando clientes, tener un negocio prospero para tener estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her husband and their four children; ages 8, 12, 11, and 14.  They work all day selling fruits and vegetables in nearby towns in their vehicle.  They go through almost the entire area.  This is how they manage to sell their vegetables and provide their children with food.

They currently need a loan to buy fresh vegetables and fruit like apples, oranges, bananas, potatoes, and tomatoes.  These products are for the business.  They also need to work on the vehicle so that it is better suited for their sales.

Her objective is to continue winning customers and to have a prosperous business in order to have financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, bananas, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 38 years old, married and has three children. She sells office equipments such as toners, printing papers and photocopy machines. In the same business premises, she offers services such as printing and photocopying.  Lillian employs three people who run her business in her absence and to assist her in the business.  

Lillian has improved her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  With 20,000 Kenya shillings she will buy toners.

loans.use: To buy toners for her printing and photocopying busness

loans.name: M. Alice

texts.fr: Mariée et ayant 3 enfants à charges, Alice vit avec ses parents. Les charges familiales sont supportées par son mari mais elle y contribue aussi, en fonction de ses revenus. Alice vend des glacières, des bols, des pagnes et autres ustensiles de cuisine dans une boutique sise à son domicile, situé dans un quartier de la ville de Cotonou. Elle a une clientèle fidèle qui est composée des habitants de sa localité et des zones environnantes. Pour faciliter l'écoulement rapide de ses produits, elle se promène parfois avec ses marchandises qu'elle propose aux voisins. La cliente mène son activité génératrice de revenus depuis plus de 15 ans et en a acquis une maîtrise avérée des rouages. Elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes du marché international du Bénin. Au terme du remboursement de son 1er crédit à FINADEV, Alice sollicite et obtient le renouvellement; ce qui pourra lui permettre de renouveler son stock pour faire face aux exigences de ses clients. Elle compte tirer un revenu supplémentaires de son activité grâce à ce prêt et comme cela accroitre sa participation à la satisfaction des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Alice is married with three dependent children, and she lives with her parents. While her husband looks after the family’s expenses, she contributes as well depending on her income. 

Alice sells coolers, bowls, kitchen utensils and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) from her home in a district of the city of Cotonou. She has a loyal customer base consisting of people from the area and surrounding neighborhoods. She sometimes sells door-to-door as well in order to liquidate her stock quickly. She has been running her business for over 15 years and has a good command of her activity. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers at the international market of Benin. 

Having reimbursed her first loan with FINADEV, Alice obtained a loan renewal to replenish her stock and meet customer demand. This new funding should help to bolster her revenue, and as a result, increase her contribution to the fulfillment of the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 coolers, 30 pagnes, and one box of bowls

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Marta Isabel es casada, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo con al apoyo de sus señores padres, hasta el momento lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su negocio, el cual lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera en el futuro contar con un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Marta Isabel, 32, is married and she went through 3 years of primary school.  She has 1 son who is in school.  12 years ago she started a knitting business with the support of her parents.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business and she will use it to buy different types and colors of thread.  In the future she hopes to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Turwanyinzara Group

texts.fr:
Damascène fait partie du groupe TURWANYINZARA. Le nom du groupe signifie « Lutter contre la famine». Il est marié avec 10 enfants de 1 mois à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. 

 Damascène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver une race améliorée de riz dans un petit espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années,Damascène voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz au Rwanda. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Damascène belongs to the TURWANYINZARA group. The group's name means "fight against famine." He is married and has 10 children, aged from 1 to 18, of whom 3 have received schooling. Damascène grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs to grow rice. His strategy for expanding his business is to grow an improved type of rice in a small area and harvest a large quantity. In the next few years, Damascène would like to become one of the best rice growers in Rwanda.

With his profit, he intends to pay for his children's education up to university level, and to become financially self-sufficient

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs to grow rice.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo,  se dedica al comercio de ropa, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre,  comenzó el negocio junto a un amigo, no tiene horario de trabajo, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio.
Su inversión será en ropa, de diferentes modas y colores, para ambos sexos como blusas, camisas, short, ropa interior, esta compra le permitirá ampliar la mercadería, ofrecer a los clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
La Aspiración de Gerardo es tener éxito en el comercio de ropa, vivir que este sea rentable, para obtener las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre a cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Gerardo works selling clothing.  He is single, and lives with his mother.  He began this business with a friend.  He doesn't have a formal work-schedule, and currently is requesting a loan to invest in the business.

His investment will be in clothes for both sexes in different styles and colors, such as blouses, shirts, shorts and underwear.  This purchase will allow him to grow his merchandise on offer, and to meet his customers needs.

Gerardo's aspiration is to have success in his clothing business, to see it be profitable, and to earn the money necessary to help his mother cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing: blouses, shirts, shorts, and underwear for his business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, married and has three children.  He runs a cereals shop to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years. Alongside his cereals shop, he sells electric items such as electric cables so as to supplement his income.  Previously, he used to sell vegetables.

Daniel has improved his business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Boston Group

texts.en:
Johannes, who is in his late 40's is married with two grown up children. He has been running Fruits and Vegetable business for one and a half years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to increase his fruits and vegetables stock. His dream is to one day be able to start selling things like rice, beets and maize grains at wholesale price.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Boston" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su madre, es soltero, administra una granja de pollos, este negocio lo inicio hace varios años su madre, crían los pollos y salen a ofrecerlos ya alineados, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer la venta. Por lo que Solicita un préstamo para comprar pollos y concentrado la idea es aumentar la granja de manera que le produzca más ganancias.
Las proyecciones de Juan son que su negocio continúe creciendo, conocer más clientes, proveer las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his mother, and is unmarried.  He manages a chicken farm, which his mother started several years back.  They raise the chickens and sell them when they're ready; they don't have a fixed schedule for when to sell them.

He is requesting the loan to buy chickens and concentrated feed, as his plan is to grow his farmyard in a way that will generated more earnings.

Juan's plans are for his business to continue growing, to gain more customers, and to earn the money necessary to help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed for his farm.

loans.name: Llankasunchis-2011 Group

texts.es:
La señora Griselda nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmenrte, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco. (En la fotografía la señora Griselda está levantando la mano). 

La señora Griselda tiene 60 años y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia,  ella está trabajando en los laboratorios H&S en el área D. cobranza y le va muy bien,ella también tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comida fría como por ejemplo papa rellena, causa y ceviche, ella tiene un local alquilado por la universidad donD. venD. sus ricos potajes. Ya son 4 meses que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Griselda requiere el préstamo para ampliar el local y para comprar insumos como arroz y azúcar.    

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Llankasunchis” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. artesanía, venta D. comida, venta comestibles, venta D. cosméticos y otros brindan servicios varios.  

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Griselda was born in Cusco department.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco (in the photograph, Griselda is raising her hand).

Griselda is 60 years old, married, and has five children from her marriage.  She is a hard-working and responsible mother who gets her family ahead in life.  She is currently working at H&S laboratories in the collections department and is doing very well.  She also has a small business selling meals such as 'papa rellena' (stuffed potatoes), 'causa rellena' (a layered potato dish) and 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish).  She hires premises at the university where she sells her delicious dishes.  She has been in this business for four months and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Griselda needs a loan to expand her premises and buy supplies such as rice and sugar.  

The 'Llankasunchis' community bank meet once a month in the city of Cusco.  The members of the community bank are hard working and entrepreneurial.  They are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and, through their daily work, they aim to proviD. their children with a better future.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and are engaged in businesses such as: selling handicrafts, selling food, selling cosmetics and providing services.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to expand her premises and buy supplies such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Lilian Giselh

texts.es:
Lilian es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de carnes, embutidos y mariscos, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, y junto a su esposo reside en la Colonia Lempira en el municipio de Juticalpa.

Lilian nació en una familia muy trabajadora que desde hace muchos se han dedicado a la venta de frutas y verduras. Y como familia escaza de recursos economicos no podian pagar empleados asi que Lilian estuvo muy involucrada en el negocio familiar. Luego los años fueron pasando y en Marzo de 2011 Lilian se casó y junto a su esposo decidió instalar en un local alquilado una venta de carnes, embutidos y mariscos. Su esposo la apoya con su negocio realizando ventas de forma ambulante, mientras ella atiende la carniceria en un horario de 6:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm.   

Lilian necesita el prestamo para la compra de diversos tipos de carnes como costilla y tajo de res, de cerdo, embutidos como ser hot dogs, chorizos, mortadela, jamon, y comprar mariscos como camarones, jailas, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estará mejor surtido y sus clientes tendran muchas opciones para comprar.   

Su sueño es procrear dos hijos, tener su propia casa y un local para no pagar alquiler. Tiene dos ciclos de trabajar en FAMA y ha sido una clienta puntual con sus pagos y eso le ha ayudado a mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilian is a micro-entrepreneur who sells meats, sausage, and shellfish.  She is 30 years old and married, and lives with her husband in the Lempira neighborhood in the town of Juticalpa.

Lilian was born into a very hard-working family that has sold fruit and vegetables for many years.  As a family of limited economic means, they weren't able to pay employees, so Lilian was very involved in the family business.  Then the years went by and in March 2011 Lilian got married, and with her husband decided to open a meat, sausage, and shellfish stall in a rented place.  Her husband supports her business by selling on foot while she tends the butcher shop from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

Lilian needs the loan to buy various types of meats such as ribs and slices of beef and pork, sausage as to make hot dogs, chorizo, mortadella, and ham, and to buy shellfish like shrimp, crab, and others.  Her business will be better stocked with the support of this loan, and her customers will have many options.

Her dream is to have two children, her own house, and her own place where she won't have to pay rent.  She has worked for two cycles with FAMA and has been punctual with her payments, which has helped her keep her business active.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, sausage, and shellfish.

loans.name: María Mercedes Elvia

texts.es:
María Mercedes es una viuda de 51 años nacida en "Latacunga" en la provincia de Cotopaxi ubicada en la cordillera de “Los Andes” en el centro del Ecuador. Ella vive con su hijo, quien es su preocupación diaria ya que sola debe cumplir con sus necesidades. La muerte de su esposo fue un acontecimiento muy duro en su vida ya que debió continuar sola. Por esta razón ella se considera una emprendedora y sobre todo una mujer trabajadora.

Desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura y ganadería que aprendió de sus padres y hoy en día este oficio es su sustento. Desde hace 22 años ella realiza su trabajo de manera independiente, es dueña de todo su ganado y trabaja una jornada de diez horas. En la provincia de Chimborazo es común que las personas se dediquen a trabajar en cultivos o en la crianza de animales. Ella quiere ahora invertir en su negocio comprando más variedad de animales y papas para así tener más variedad de productos que ofertar y con ello obtener mayores ingresos.

A María le preocupa la educación de su hijo y sobre todo poder sustenta sus necesidades básicas por ello María diariamente trabaja muy duro para lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a 51 year old widow born in Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi which is located in the central Ecuadorian Andes. She lives with her son who is her daily concern because she, alone, has to meet his needs. The death of her husband was a very difficult event in her life because she has had to continue on by herself. For this reason, she is considered a very enterprising and above all, hard-working, woman.

Since she was very small, Maria has worked in agriculture and cattle raising, tasks she learned from her parents. Nowadays this work is her means of support. For 22 years, she has been an independent farmer and she owns her own cattle. She works 10 hours a day. It is common for people to be agriculturalists and raise cattle in Cotopaxi province. Now she wants to invest in her business by buying a greater variety of animals as well as potatoes so that she will have a greater variety of products to sell and in this way earn more income.

Maria is concerned about her son’s education and above all about being able to meet his basic needs.  Consequently, she works very hard every day in order to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy cattle and potatoes to market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He does carpentry to earn a living. He started this business six years ago and has employed one person. He also runs a grocery for extra income. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. This has helped him to improve his business, save his money, and invest.

Pater hopes to own a timber yard within five years. With a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he will buy timber to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbu Group

texts.es:
Este comité de la ciudad de Asunción, llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbú es un comité que esta  en el décimo Tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, actualmente cuenta con 16 integrantes. Ellas gracias a su inmenso sacrificio han podido ir superando todas las etapas anteriores del programa. Ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia, las cuales luchan diariamente por es sustento de su familia.
Una de las integrantes de quien podemos hablar es la señora Norma, ella comenta que trabaja arduamente en su negocio todos los días. Ella tiene una peluquería, mediante la cual puede mantener a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno de sus sueños es poder abrir su peluquería en su propia casa, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con tintes, talcos, sprays, gel y otros insumos necesarios para su negocio. Desea poder seguir creciendo y cuenta que de obtener el crédito le dará muy buena utilidad.
texts.en:
The committee Entrepreneurial Women of Tacumbú, from the city of Asunción, is in the thirteenth cycle of the women’s committee of Fundación Paraguaya program, and currently has 16 members.  Thanks to immense sacrifice, the members have been able to go beyond all the previous stages of the program.  They define themselves as female heads of households who struggle daily to support their families.

Norma is one of the members we can talk about; she works hard in her business every day.  She is a hairdresser, by which she supports her family and alleviates the daily household expenses that come up.  One of her dreams is to open a hair salon in her own home, so that she can work better.  She requests the loan to supply her business with dyes, powders, sprays, gel and other necessary products.  She hopes to continue growing and is counting on getting the loan, which will give her very good profit.

loans.use: buy dyes, powders, sprays, gel and other products.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel tiene 40 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, viven en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos de 10 y 07 años, a quienes desea darles una buena educación. El trabajo de Fidel consiste en la siembra de pimienta y yuca, asimismo se encarga de la cosecha, actividades que lo ejerce en su propia chacra y del que diario le dedica todo su tiempo. Tiene 20 años trabajando en este trabajo y aún tiene la misma ganas para salir adelante; él recuerda que cuando empezó muy joven lo hacía solo y en algunas ocasiones contrataba jornaleros para que le ayuden en la siembra y cosecha y así poder tener todos sus productos a tiempo. Le gusta mucho la actividad que realiza, pues creció gracias a ello y ahora es primordial para poder educar a sus hijos. Por tanto, su producción de yuca lo vende en el mercado de su localidad, en tanto el pimiento lo envía a la ciudad de Lima para su comercialización. Este será el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, espera poder seguir siendo el socio puntual como lo conocen, además menciona que está muy feliz con su grupo por que todos son muy responsables. Espera continuar trabajando juntos ya que le es de mucha ayuda el apoyo que ustedes le dan. Con el monto solicitado, comprará semillas de yuca y pimiento para la siguiente siembra y una res, pues desea empezar con la crianza de animal vacuno.
texts.en:
Fidel is 40 and is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his partner and their two sons, 10 and 7 years old, for whom he wants to provide a good education. 

He works planting peppers and cassava and also harvests them, work he does in his own fields, every day, full time. He has spent 20 years as a farmer and he still has the same dedication to get ahead. He remembers that when he began as a very young man, he did it all by himself and at times he hired laborers to help with the planting and harvesting so that he was able to finish in time. He enjoys his work very much because he was able to grow thanks to it and now it is essential in order to educate his sons. He sells his cassava crop at a local market and he sends his peppers to Lima for marketing.

This will be his fifth loan with MFP and he expects to continue being the punctual member that he is known to be. As well, he mentions that he is happy with his group and that all are very responsible. He hopes to continue working with you as the support that you all have given him has helped a great deal. With the amount requested, he will buy cassava and pepper seeds for the next planting, as well as a head of cattle, since he wants to begin raising cattle.

loans.use:
.
to buy cassava and pepper seeds as well as a head of cattle.

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es:
Adrian, es agricultor, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo, todos trabajan en la familia, su actividad la desempeña desde hace mucho, no tiene un horario establecido para atender la agricultura, todos los días está al pendiente de cualquier necesidad en los cultivos.
Actualmente comprara insumos como abono y herbicidas para tratar durante el crecimiento al cultivo, esta compra le ayudara para cuidar y protegerlo de las plagas.
Su aspiración es tener una milpa provechosa, con abundantes frutos y proveer a la familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Adrian is a farmer.  He lives with his family, his wife and son, and they all work.  He has done this kind of work for a long time; he doesn’t have a set schedule to tend to the farm – he is always aware of crop needs.  Now he will buy products like fertilizer and herbicides to treat the crops as they grow.  This purchase will help him care for and protect his crops from pests.  He aspires to have a prosperous cornfield, with plenty of fruit, and to be able to provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe A Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe A. Le nom du groupe signifie « s’unir ». Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 3 à 30 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. 

Emmanuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le meilleur cultivateur de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the group Abishyizehamwe A. The name of the group means "to unite." Emmanuel is married with eight children ranging in age from 3 to 30 years old. Six of them go to school.

Emmanuel is rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to purchase fertilizer and pay for the labor.

His business growth strategy is to use chemical fertilizers, farm a small area, and produce a substantial crop. In the coming years, Emmanuel hopes to become the best rice farmer in the valley. He will use the profits to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor needed for his rice growing activity

loans.name: Bai Aline

texts.fr: Avec 3 enfants à charge, Aline vit en location dans une banlieue à l'Ouest de Cotonou. Elle est couturière de formation, à cette activité elle a associé la vente de pagnes et des habits qu'elle confectionne pour mettre en vente afin de mieux faire face à sa part des charges du ménage. Avec la bonne situation géographique de son de son atelier et la finesse de sa couture, elle arrive à fidéliser et à drainer de nouveaux clients. Son 1er crédit soldé, Aline obtient un renouvellement afin de approvisionner en matériels nécessaires à la confection des boubou brodés qu'elle vend. Grâce à ce prêt et au revenu complémentaire qu’elle en tirera, elle pourra améliorer le confort de sa famille.
texts.en:
Raising three children, Aline lives in a suburban location west of Cotonou. She is a trained seamstress and she also sells African print cloth and garments that she sews up for sale so that she can do her share in supporting the household. 

With the good geographic location of her workshop and the quality of her sewing, she manages to attract new customers and make them into repeat clients. Aline has repaid her first loan and is now receiving another so that she can buy the necessary materials to make the embroidered "boubous" (loose West African dress worn by men and women) that she sells. Thanks to this loan, and the added income she will garner from it, she will be able to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy 30 lengths of African print cloth and 10 cartons of embroidery thread.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 31 years old and married. He sells kerosene to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save money and gained more skills to run his business.

Currently, Ephantus is using containers while selling kerosene, which is not efficient. He hopes to buy a kerosene pump, which will make his work easier. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more kerosene for his business.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene.

loans.name: Kabungo Back To Light Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Hope exemplifies the essence of diligence. The past seven years for this warm-hearted and congenial mother of five have been years of calling forth success in her banana farming business. 

Hope principally grows bananas and so far it has been to her advantage. Bananas are a highly favored staple food in most parts of Western Uganda, and on the face of it, people engaged in the sale of bananas are very successful. The combination of the low common denominators around her operating area and the strong banana sales business has been the critical turning point for Hope's business. The long and short of it is that they provide a market for her bananas.

Hope's odds of further success are looking rosier every day on the basis of the fact that food entrepreneurs from neighboring countries like Rwanda are increasing banana purchases from Ntungamo, from where she runs her business.

Hope's weekly sales returns are to the tune of 80,000 Uganda shillings. She says that she intends to use part of her Kiva loan to purchase high grade manure and the rest will go to the payment of school dues for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure, and the rest will go to the payment of school dues for her kids.

loans.name: Walter Carlos

texts.es:
Walter de 29 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

La actividad que desarrolla Walter es brindar el servicio de transporte público, ya que cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo trabaja mañana y tarde movilizando personas que viven en Paijan, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos de su mototaxi.  Walter es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 29 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents. The only service he receives is electricity. Walter resides in the District of Paijan, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This area is known for agriculture and livestock breeding.

Walter’s business involves providing public transportation services. He has his own motorcycle taxi that he drives in the morning and afternoons in order to transport people who live in Paijan. Walter has his own customer base and the income he generates helps to cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN so that he can maintain his motorcycle taxi and replace the parts. Walter is a person who is well-known in the area where he lives because he is concerned about the welfare of his family. His goal for the future is to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle taxi and replace the parts.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 43 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 07, 03 años y el último de 03 meses de nacido, a quienes desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos viven en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Guillermo consiste en la reparación de motores, motos, maquinaria pesada y otros. Él hace su trabajo a domicilio, va quien lo necesita. Tiene 12 años realizando este trabajo y es muy bueno en lo que hace y es por eso que siempre le llaman para solucionar los problemas de las maquinas de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que genera ingresos a su hogar haciendo algo que le gusta, además de tener un horario que el mismo maneja. Espera mas adelante seguir trabajando como hasta ahora, por ello pide el apoyo de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. El monto solicitado comprará repuestos, accesorios y algunas herramientas para implementar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 43, is a hardworking and responsible gentleman. He is married and has four children (ages 12, 7, 3, and 3 months) for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. They live in their own home. Guillermo’s work involves repairing engines, motorcycles, heavy machinery, and other items. He works from home and provides his services to whoever needs them. Guillermo has been in this profession for 12 years and is very good at what he does. For this reason, he is always called upon to solve mechanical problems for his customers. What he enjoys most about his work is being able to earn an income doing something he loves. In addition, he has a work schedule that he is able to manage.

Guillermo hopes to move forward and keep working, but for now, he is requesting assistance so that he can continue. The amount he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts, accessories, and a few tools so that he can perform his job.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, accessories, and a few tools.

loans.name: Cristina Lizeth

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven madre soltera nacida en la ciudad de Ibarra en la provincia de "Imbabura". Tiene una hija de 3 años, actualmente vive en su lugar de nacimiento. Ibarra es una ciudad de la sierra del Ecuador ubicada al norte del país. Su clima es cálido ya que se encuentra en uno de los valles de la provincia. Conocida como "la ciudad blanca a la que siempre se vuelve" es cuna de las más grandes estrellas del fútbol soccer ecuatoriano.

Trabaja medio tiempo en una tienda de venta de artículos plásticos y el resto del día vende ropa por catálogo, en ninguna de las actividades recibe ayuda. Ella desea un préstamo para comprar mercadería para ofertar a sus clientes por esta razón ella se acercó a Fundación Alternativa. La inversión específicamente la hará en ropa. Tiene la esperanza que con esta inversión mejoren sus ingresos.

Esta joven mujer es amante de la música y de la lectura, también ama los deportes. Su gran obstáculo ha sido no poder continuar con los estudios universitarios y ese es su mayor anhelo. Ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida con su pequeño crédito.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young single mother who was born in the city of Ibarra in Imbabura Province. She has a three-year-old daughter and currently lives in her hometown. Ibarra is a city located in the mountains of northern Ecuador. The climate is cold since the city is located in one of the valleys in the province. Ibarra is known as “the white city that always returns” and is the birthplace of the most famous Ecuadorian soccer stars.

Cristina works part-time at a store that sell plastic goods and the rest of her day is spent selling clothes through catalogs. She does not receive help with any of her business activities. Cristina wants a loan so that she can buy merchandise to offer to her customers. For this reason, she approached Fundación Alternativa. This investment will be used specifically to buy clothing. She hopes that this investment will improve her income.

This young woman loves music and reading. She is also a sports fan. Her greatest obstacle has been not being able to continue her university studies, which is her greatest wish. Cristina hopes to improve her quality of life with this small loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón, vive con su esposa y trabajan juntos en la venta de granos básicos, no tienen un horario fijo para atender el negocio, y por el momento quiere compra mercadería para aumentar el inventario.
El está solicitando un préstamo para comprar maíz, ya que quieren tener suficiente para un largo periodo, ya que sus clientes lo demandan y en este momento se puede comprar a mejor precio.
Don Napoleón quiere continuar trabajando para aumentar cada día el negocio, la clientela y las ganancias.
texts.en:
Napoleon lives with his wife and they work together selling staple grains.  They don't have a set schedule to see to their business and at the moment they want to buy merchandise to increase their inventory.

He is asking for a loan to buy corn, as they want to have enough for a long period of time since their customers demand it and right now they can buy it at a good price.

Napoleon wants to keep working to make his business, his clientele, and his earnings grow every day.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living and has been in the business for four years. She has grown her business through the knowledge she gained from trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management.

Her desire is to open a boutique in five years. For this reason, she works hard in her business to generate enough capital. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, vive con sus dos hijos, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de tamales, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, debido a la necesidad de trabajar para sus hijos.
Idalia, Comprara materiales para hacer tamales y enchiladas, la compra será específicamente en: pollo, maíz, condimentos, aceite, de esta forma continuara produciendo para vender y  espera que su negocio marche bien siempre con ganancias en las ventas.
Sueña con ampliarse en sus negocios, atender la tamalería y el comercio de ropa de la mejor manera, mejorando los ingresos y que su condición económica sea más solvente.
texts.en:
Idalia lives with her two children.  She is a single mother who sells tamales for a living.  She started this business on her own initiative because she needed to work for her children.

Idalia will buy ingredients to make tamales and enchiladas.  Specifically, she will buy chicken, corn, condiments, and oil, and this will allow her to continue producing to sell.  She hopes that her business will always do well with earnings from sales.

She dreams of expanding her businesses, of handling her tamale business and her clothing business in the best way, of improving earnings and of being in a more solvent financial state.

loans.use: to buy chicken, corn, condiments, and oil to prepare enchiladas and tamales.

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
Luis es un señor de 21 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Francisco de la Palmera, localizada en San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros.

Hace poco Luis tuvo que detener la construcción de su vivienda, ya que no tenía suficiente dinero para seguir. 
Actualmente Luis está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de más madera y materiales para finalizar la construcción de su hogar, habitar en la misma y poder tener una vida digna y tranquila.

Con esta inversión espera que su familia viva estable. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder seguir adelante y superarse como familia.

Luis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Luis is a 21-year-old gentleman who lives with his family in a community called San Francisco de La Palma, which is located in San Carlos in Alajuela Province. This rural community has great potential for development since there are already existing businesses tied to agriculture, such as raising cattle, and available community services. There is also opportunity for small retailers, microenterprises, and other ventures.

Luis recently had to delay the construction of his home because he does not have enough money to continue. At the moment, he is requesting a microloan in the amount of 600,000 CRC in order to buy more wood and materials to finish the construction of his house so that he can live in it and have a decent and peaceful life.

With this investment, he hopes that his family will have stability. All of this assistance will improve his living conditions so that Luis and his loved ones can move forward and grow as a family.

Luis is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Francisco de La Palma, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. In addition, he will be an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for finishing his house.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is 42 years old and married with a 20-year-old child. She owns a beauty college. She opened the college over 20 years ago. She has employed six people in her college, including teachers. Her aim while opening the college was to develop skills in hair dressing among the young teenage girls.

She has witnessed her college improving since she serviced her first loan from Faulu Kenya. Her dream is to open other branches of her college. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a steaming machine to be used for teaching in her school.

loans.use: To buy a steaming machine.

loans.name: Romelia Paola

texts.es:
Romelia es una joven de 20 años de edad, casada, y se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Inició con su negocio hace tres años atras y aprendió de su madre ya que esta actividad comercial es muy antigua y muy comun en la comunidad Juticalpense. 

Su pequeña venta de golosinas esta instalada en la calle que pasa al frende de la casa de sus padres ya que por falta de recursos economicos no ha podido mudarse ni tampoco alquilar un local. Su horario de atencion los dias de semana inicia desde las 4:00 pm y culmina a las 10:00 pm y en fin de semana culmina a la medianoche o dependiendo de la cantidad de clientes que alla en el lugar. 

El prestamo que Romelia esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar carne de cerdo y res, pollo, refrescos, harina, aceite, leña, verduras, polipel, canastillas de plastico, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella tendra lo necesario para seguir elaborando sus golosinas y mantener activo su negocio.

Su mayor problema es que el personal de la Alcaldia Municipal los desaloje por ser vendedores ambulantes, pero aun asi no se deja vencer por las adversidades y sigue adelante con muchas ganas de tener su propio local y su propia casa. 

Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha sido una clienta muy puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
