Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para su bodega, además de comprar algunos repuestos y accesorios para su vulcanizadora.
texts.en:
Selmita, 50, is a very brave, very gentle woman.  She’s been married to her husband for many years and is the mother of an 18-year-old son who is still a student.  She lives with her husband and son in her own house where she works alongside them in order to have a better quality of life.

Selmita’s work consists in grocery sales because she has a small grocery store installed in her house.  She also offers a few catalogue items to her customers who for the most part are friends, neighbors and family members.  On the other hand, she also has a mototaxi, a vehicle that she leases out to those wanting to provide public transportation services.  She’s been doing all these kinds of work for 17 years and has generated income to share family expenses with her husband.  Her store is quite busy because she treats her customers well and she has everything they need so her income is good and she does well in this work.  She hopes later on to set up an additional business, like the sale of motorcycle spare parts and a tire repair shop.

This will be loan #16 with MFP.  She’s a founding member and very diligent with her payments.  She will use the requested amount to buy stock items for her store as well as a few replacement parts and accessories for her tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese curd, cracklings, oil and condiments to make pupusas.

loans.name: Marvin Manuel

texts.es:
Marvin, de 50 años de edad, originario de Posoltega una comunidad localizada en el departamento de Chinandega, pero vive en Leo el esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos, el es comerciante, dueño de un molino. El aprendió a desarrollarse en el mundo del comercio desde muy joven cuando ayudaba a su padre a vender granos básicos. El adquirió el negocio del molino por medio de un tío que le dejo este negocio de herencia, lleva 25 años con su negocio de molinos.
El realizo el préstamo para comprar un motor estacionario para su molino. Ya que actualmente le están haciendo un molino de 3 maquinas pero necesita su motor y el préstamo le ayudaría a conseguirlo. A el le gustaría abrir mas puestos de molinos para poder expandirse mas y poder empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Marvin, 50, is originally from Posoltega, a community located in Chinandega Department, but he lives in Leo.  He’s married and the father of three children.  He’s a merchant; he owns a mill.  He learned how to develop in the world of commerce since he was very young and helped his father sell basic grains.  He acquired the milling business from an uncle who left him the business as an inheritance.  He’s been in the milling business for 25 years.

He took out the loan to buy a stationary motor for his mill.  He is having a three-machine mill made but it needs its motor and the loan will help him acquire it.  He’d like to open more milling stands to expand more and be able to employ more people.

loans.use: para comprar un motor estacionario para su molino to buy a stationary motor for his mill.

loans.name: Ana Lucy

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca,  su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Ana tiene 47 años, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 28, 19 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera, trabaja y ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo es casado e independiente y su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Ana es comerciante, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías como figuras elaboradas en mármol, las cuales trae de otra ciudad, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y su producto lo vende ambulantemente.

En el banco comunal esta 2 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más artesanías.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Quinta Chica Parish in the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  Many work in the city in various jobs.  They are kind and gentle people.

Ana, 47, is married and has three children who are 28, 19 and 14 years old.  Her oldest daughter is single, employed and helps out economically.  Her next son is married and independent and her youngest daughter is going to a local secondary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.  She does not own a house, she a renter.

Ana is a merchant; she sells crafts like marble figurines that she brings from another city.  She’s been a street vendor in this business for 10 years.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and will use the loan to buy more crafts.  Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Maritza Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora Roció vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

Doña Roció tiene 20 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Roció se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de la marca Yanbal, esta labor la realiza hace 2 años y labora en esta actividad por lo que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos que aun están pequeños. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su tía. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es sacar en adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Roció lives in Quinta Chica parish, in the city of Cuenca.  The local people work in commerce, raise animals, farm and many work in the city in different business activities.  They are a very kind and friendly people.

Roció is 20 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 4 and 1.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't own their own home but rent instead.

Roció's business is selling Yanbal-brand cosmetics through a catalog.  She has been doing this work for two years and it gives her the opportunity to care for her children who are still young.

This is Roció's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by her aunt.  She will invest her loan in buying perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry so that she can continue in her business.  Her goal is to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado y no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace algún tiempo y vende en los días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de  camisetas, pantalones, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Quinta Chica Parish in the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  Many work in the city in various jobs.  They are kind and charming people.

Rosa, 30, is married and has a four-year-old son.  Her husband is a private employee and they do not own a house; they rent.  

She sells all sorts of clothes.  She’s been in this line of work for some time now selling on market days.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children’s clothes to stock her business more.  Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos Alfredo es un joven de 21 años de edad que se dedica a brindar productos y servicios funebres, es casado y junto a su esposa reside en el municipio de Danli. 

Carlos aprendió de su negocio trabajando un año como ayudante en una funeraria, y un dia se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir una funeraria y no lo pensó dos veces y decidió aventurarse a dejar de ser asalariado para pasar a microempresario. Desde entonces Carlos tiene su propia funeraria y su esposa le ayuda con la atencion al cliente. Atiende las 24 horas y los siete dias de las semana, hasta dias feriados, por el dia Carlos sale a ofrecers sus servicios funebres y a tratar de conseguir contratos y por las noches descansa y se ocupa de estar en la funeraria, y aunque las instalaciones permanecen cerradas a menos de que haya un velorio, é siempre está pendiente del timbre y del telefono, esto por el temor de que los lleguen a asaltar. 

Carlos solicita el prestamo para comprar diversos materiales como madera, pintura y adornos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podrá tener mas variedad de productos de acuerdo a las necesidades de cada familia. 

Su desafio es poder comprar un carro porque cuando contratan sus servicios a domicilio tiene que pagar flete para que le trasladen todo lo necesario para la vela. Su sueño es tener varias funerarias en diferentes partes del departamento de El Paraiso.

Este es el primer credito de Carlos y espera cumplir con el compromiso del pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo, 21, is a young man dedicated to providing funeral services.  He’s married and lives with his wife in the town of Danli.

Carlos learned his craft working as an assistant in a funeral parlor for a year.  One day the opportunity to acquire a funeral parlor arose and he did not have to think about it twice and decided to take on the adventure of no longer being a salaried employee and becoming a micro businessman.  Since then, Carlos has had his own funeral parlor and his wife helps him with customer service.  He’s available 24 hours a day, seven days a week and even on holidays.  During the day, Carlos goes out to offer his funeral services and tries to get contracts and during the night he rests and tries to be at the funeral parlor even though the installations are closed unless there’s a wake taking place.  He’s always alert to the doorbell and telephone because he fears being assaulted.

Carlos is requesting the loan to buy various materials like lumber, paint and decorations.  Support from the loan will make it possible for him to have a wider variety of products to meet each family’s needs.

His challenge is being able to buy a vehicle because when he is contracted to provide in-home services he has to pay transportation cost for everything necessary for the wake.  His dream is to own several funeral parlors in different parts of El Paraíso Department.

This is Carlos’ first loan and he expects to make all his installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paint and decorations.

loans.name: Ivania Mercedes

texts.es:
Ivania, de 32 años de edad, nacida en la ciudad de León, soltera, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender comida, también vende ropa. Ella heredo este negocio de venta de comida por medio de una tía que le enseño a preparar comida y a venderla pues su tía realizo esta labor durante 30 años y ella le ayudaba y esto le sirvió de experiencia, decidió  vender ropa como segundos ingresos también trabajo como domestica pero hoy en día es la que dirige este negocio de venta de comida.    
Solicito el préstamo para comprar ropa para dama y C., invertir en compras de carnes, verduras que son ingredientes que ocupa para vender y preparar comidas, gaseosas. Con esta inversion Tendrá disponibilidad de productos para prepara sus platillos y mercadería para vender. Sus metas son poner una tienda de ropa en general, comprar maniquís y vitrinas para poner en exhibición sus productos. Desea superarme como mujer micro empresaria y tener la capacidad de brindar empleos a mujeres como ella que tengan deseos de superación.
texts.en:
32-year-old Ivania was born in the city of León.  She is single and her business is selling food.  She also sells clothes.  She inherited the food business from an aunt who taught her how to make food and sell it.  Her aunt carried out this business for 30 years and she helped her.  This gave her experience.  Ivania decided to sell clothes as a second source of income.  She also worked as a domestic but now she runs the food business.

Ivania requested this loan to buy men's and women's clothes; to invest in buying meat and vegetables, which are the ingredients she uses to prepare and sell her meals; and to buy soda.  With this investment, she will have products available with which to prepare her dishes and also merchandise to sell.  Her goals are to set up a general clothes store and to buy mannequins and display cases with which to display her products.  She would like to do well as a small businesswoman and have the ability to provide jobs to women such as herself who have a desire to do well.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes; to invest in buying meat and vegetables, which are the ingredients she uses to prepare and sell her meals; and to buy soda

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, este lugar cuenta con una gran belleza natural y su gente es muy hospitalaria, su gastronomía es muy variada y  su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. 

Doña Mónica tiene 35 años, es separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 13 años de edad que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada privada de domingo a domingo en horarios rotativos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the 'El Cruce hacia el Futuro' community bank.  She lives in Sinincay parish which has great natural beauty.  Its people are very hospitable.  The local cuisine is very varied and the people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Mónica is 35 years old.  She is separated but she has a 13-year-old daughter from her marriage.  Her daughter attends school in the city.  Mónica does not own her own home and so lives in her mom's house, sharing the household expenses.

Mónica works as a private employee from Sunday to Sunday.  She works shifts.  She has been a member of her community bank for one and a half years and she will invest her new loan in buying provisions for her household.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, de 29 años de edad, es originario de Quezalguaque municipio de León, padre de dos hijos, el es quien mantiene a su familia, el es chofer de un taxi, este es su medio de subsistencia. El lleva 5 años trabajando como taxista anteriormente el trabajaba como obrero en una fabrica pero la empresa cerro y el se quedo sin trabajo así que con la liquidación que la empresa le dio decidió comprar un carro usado y hacerlo taxi pues su situación económica no le permitía permanecer mucho tiempo sin trabajo y su familia dependía totalmente de el así que busco la manera de cómo generar ingresos por su propia cuenta.   
Solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos para su taxi, mejorar los asientos del carro y compra de llantas. Con esta inversión espera darle una mejor presentación a su taxi, para brindar mejor confort y comodidad a sus clientes. En sus planes futuros desea poder comprar otro taxi para trabajar y dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
29-year-old José is originally from Quezalguaque, in León.  He has two children and he is the one who supports his family.  José is a taxi driver.  This is the means by which he survives.  He has been working as a taxi driver for five years.  He used to work as a factory worker but the company closed down and he found himself unemployed.  He used the redundancy money that his company gave him to buy a used car to use as a taxi as his financial situation did not allow him to spend much time without a job and his family relied on him completely.  He looked for a way to make income himself.

José requested this loan to buy spare parts for his taxi (to improve his car seats and to buy tires).  Through this investment, he hopes to make his taxi more presentable and provide better comfort for his customers.  His future plans include buying another taxi and providing work for other people.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi (to improve his car's seats and to buy tires)

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio es el Sr. Javier; el socio a nacido en el año de 1975 y es conviviente, el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio es auxiliar de desarrollo económico, el socio también tiene su tienda de alquiler de equipo para camping y viajes  como treeking, tours; el socio desea invertir en la compra de carpas, sleeping, zapatillas para trek; el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo para camping.
Los otros socios trabajan en diferentes actividades como fotografía, comercio minorista,  venta de ropa, venta de productos de salud entre otros.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Javier belongs to the 'Dos de Mayo' community bank which is located in Huanchac community, in Cusco province and department.  Javier was born in 1975 and lives with his partner.  He has two children.  Javier is a financial development assistant.  He also has a store where he rents out equipment for camping, trekking and tours.  He would like to invest this money in buying tents, sleeping bags and trekking shoes.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying camping equipment.

The other members of this group work in different businesses such as photography, retail sales, clothes sales, health product sales, etc.  Javier is grateful for the support he is being given and so pledges to make his loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying camping equipment

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Jenny es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, este lugar cuenta con una gran belleza natural y su gente es muy hospitalaria,  su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. 

La Señora Jenny tiene 24 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra pero independientes.

Nuestra socia tiene en un centro de copiado y papelería, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años.

Es su segundo crédito en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y artículos de oficina para su papelería.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que le faltan puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the “El Cruce hacia el Futuro” communal bank.  She lives in Sinincay Parish.  This place has much natural beauty and its inhabitants are very hospitable.  Its cuisine is quite varied.  Residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.

Jenny is 24 years old, married and has no children yet.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own a house.  They live in her mother-in-law’s house but independently.

She has a copy center and stationery shop.  She works Monday through Friday from 8am until 7pm.  She’s been in business for two years.

This is the second loan with the communal bank and she’ll invest it in the purchase of school supplies and office supplies for her stationery shop.  Her goal is to finish building her house; it still needs doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and office supplies.

loans.name: Elsa Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, este lugar cuenta con una gran belleza natural y su gente es muy hospitalaria, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. 

Doña Elsa tiene 51 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 28, 26, 24 y 15 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora Elsa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y cuyes, a los que los vende en su comunidad. También labora como empleada domestica.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es hacer algunos arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the 'El Cruce hacia el Futuro' community bank.  She lives in Shinincay parish.  This area has great natural beauty and the local people are very hospitable.  The cuisine is wide ranging and the people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Elsa is 51 years old, divorced and has four children from her marriage who are 28, 26, 24 and 15.  Her eldest three children are married and live independently.  Her youngest (a daughter) is attending a high school in the city.  She owns the house in which she lives.

Elsa's business is raising and selling chickens, pigs and guinea pigs which she sells in her community.  She also works as a maid.

Elsa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens and animal feed.  Her goal is to make some repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es:
Brenda, una joven de 24 años de edad, soltera, egresada de la carrera de turismo, originaria de la ciudad de León, ella es dueña de un cyber café. Inicio con este negocio hace un año, este ha sido su primer negocio, la falta de empleo la impulso a emprender su propio negocio y además en su vecindario no hay un negocio que brinde este servicio de cyber café y eso es una ventaja que posee. Sus padres han sido quienes la han apoyado desde el principio. 
Realizo el préstamo para comprar una impresora, una fotocopiadora. Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes al tener maquinaria más moderna para trabajar. 
En sus planes futuros esta mejorar local, comprar mas computadoras y ofrecer mejor tecnología. Ella se visualiza como una microempresaria exitosa brindando oportunidades de trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en: Brenda, a young single woman, is 24 with a degree in tourism. She is from the city of León and is the owner of an internet café. She started this business, her first, a year ago. The lack of employment impelled her to launch her own business. Additionally, there is no other business in her neighborhood which offers internet services, and that gives her an advantage. Her parents are the ones who have given her support from the beginning. She requests the loan in order to purchase a printer and a photocopier. With this investment, she can provide better service to her customers by having more modern equipment to work on. Her future plans include improving the premises, buying more computers, and offering better technology. She envisions herself as a successful micro-business offering opportunities for work to other people.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and photocopier

loans.name: Gladys Ximena

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 29 años, es casada  y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en su propio taller, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Gladys labora como empleada privada y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, realiza sus ventas ambulantemente y lleva 4 años en esta actividad.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de  blusas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa de niños para crecer en esta actividad.
  
Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the communal bank Las Caleras. She lives in the Camino al Tejar area in the city of Cuenca, which is the third-most important city in the country. Since 1999 it has been listed as a UNESCO Cultural Heritage Site, due to the beauty of its architecture. 

Gladys is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children from her marriage, 13 and 11 years of age, who study at a school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic, and works in his own shop. She does not have her own house, and lives with her parents and shares the household expenses. 

Doña Gladys works as a housekeeper Monday to Saturday from 8 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon. In her free time, she sells clothing door-to-door, and has done so for 4 years. 

This is her fourth loan through the communal bank, and she plans to invest it in purchasing blouses, T-shirts, pants, and children's clothing to grow her business. Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, T-shirts, pants, and children's clothing

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LUCERO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachona en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Soledad; tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos; la socia tiene su propio negocio, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella trabaja administrando y atendiendo la tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en cajas,  entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes.
Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de productos secos, a la atención de la panadería, a trabajar en una empresa de luz,  a la distribución de bebidas frías.
 La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Soledad belongs to the LUCERO communal bank, located in Cachona District in Cusco Province and Department. 

Soledad is 45, married, and has 4 children. She has her own grocery store, tending the store and doing the administrative work herself. She wants to invest in purchasing rice, sugar, noodles, cartons of milk, and other items. Soledad requests the loan to purchase these grocery products. 

The other members do a variety of work, including buying and selling dry goods, running a bakery, working for a light company, and distributing cold drinks. Soledad is grateful for the support you give her and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera  ciudad más importante del país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue  nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

Doña María tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 6 hijos de 21, 19, 18, 15, 12, 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su tercera hija es casada e independiente, su cuarta hija pasa en casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de granizados, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de granos cocinados, que los cocina muy temprano en la mañana y los vende en los días de ferias.

Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de granos para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Las Caleras' community bank.  She lives in Camino al Tejar, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 owing to the beauty of its architecture.

María is 40 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage who are 21, 19, 18, 15, 12 and 10 years old.  Her two eldest children work and help out financially.  Her third child [a daughter] is married and lives independently.  Her fourth child [a daughter] stays at home and helps her with the housework, and the two youngest children attend school in the city.  Her husband sells 'granizados' (snowcones).  They own the house in which they live.  They acquired it as a result of their hard work.
 
María sells all kinds of cooked grains.  She cooks them very early in the morning and sells them on market days.

This is María's fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying grains so that she can continue in her business.

Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Karina Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señorita. Karina es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más  importante de país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

La Señorita. Karina tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es carpintero de profesión y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Nuestra socia estudia en una universidad de la ciudad y está en primer año de contabilidad y auditoría. Ella tiene  una tienda de comestibles  hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fué invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de azúcar, fideos, aceites, arroz, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the 'Las Caleras' community bank.  She lives in Camino al Tejar, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its architecture.

Karina is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad is a carpenter by trade and her mom looks after the house.  They rent the house in which they live.

Karina is studying at a university in the city and is in her first year of an accountancy and auditing degree.  She has had her own grocery store for one year and works there from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.

This is Karina's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan in buying sugar, noodles, oil, rice, detergents and other basic household products with which to stock her store.

Karina's goal is to finish her studies and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, oil, rice, detergents and other basic household products

loans.name: Yelena

texts.es: Yelena tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y responsable, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de seis años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia e intentan dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. El trabajo de Yelena consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas, además tiene un mototaxi que alquila, y eso significa un ingreso extra en su hogar. Por otro lado posee una pequeña chacra, en el cual se encarga de trabajarlo en sociedad con su pareja. Lleva haciendo estas actividades recién por dos años y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que trabaja a lado de su hijo ya que el tiempo le da es para poder cuidarlo. Su casa esta ubicado en un punto estratégico y así tiene clientes todos los días y eso le genera buenas ventas y ganancias, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que se siente cómoda con lo que tiene. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes parsa invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que le refaccionará su moto, asimismo comprará bebidas para tener mas variedad en su tienda.
texts.en:
Yelena is 38 years old.  She is a very cheerful, kind and responsible woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have a 6-year-old son.  They live in their own home and are trying to provide their son with a better quality of life.

Yelena's business is selling carbonated drinks.  She also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents out and this makes an additional income for her household.  In addition, she owns a small farm where she works together with her partner.  She has been working in these businesses for two years and has the support of her partner.  What she enjoys about her work is that she works alongside her son and is able to care for him.  Yelena's home is located in a strategic position and so she has customers every day.  This means she has good sales and makes good profits.  She hopes to be able to keep her business going as she feels comfortable with what she has.

This will be Yelena's fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can invest in her business.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi.  She will also pay the mechanic who will refurbish her motorcycle and buy drinks so that she has a greater variety in her store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica tiene 31 años, es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 09 y 01 año. Juntos quieren salir adelante, viven en sucasa propia en donde brindan educación a sus hijos y trabajan a diario para darles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Yessica consiste en la compra, venta, pues cría pollos, patos, gallinas, chanchos, además tiene plasntas que le dan buenos frutos por temporada. Por otro lado ella es dueña de un mototaxi que alquila y eso significa un ingreso más a su hogar. Tiene cinco años ejerciendo estas actividades y lo que le gusta es lo que hace en compañía de su familia. Loa productos que cosecha son llevados cada tres días al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, en donde los comercializa. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará animales además de forraje.
texts.en:
Yessica, age 31, is an enterprising and responsible woman.  She lives with her life partner, and they have four children; ages 17, 15, 9, and 1.  They want to get ahead together.  They live in their own house, where they give their children an education and work daily to give them a better quality of life.

Yessica’s work consists of buying and selling.  She raises chickens, ducks, hens, and pigs.  She also has plants that produce good seasonal fruits.  She also owns a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that she rents out, which means one more income for her household.  

She has been doing these business activities for five years.  What she likes is what she does in the company of her family.  Every three days the products that she harvests are taken to the wholesale market in the city where she sells them.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes to have the help of each one of you in order to continue with her work.  She will use the requested loan to buy animals and feed.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 57 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy entusiasta, es madre pero separada de su pareja. Tiene cinco hijos, y solo uno vive con ella, por tanto se encarga de su educación y alimentación. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agrícultura, que desde muy temprano se dirige a su chacra para cultivar, regar y arar la tierra y cuidar de sus plantas. Tiene 30 años ejerciendo esta actividad y con ello educo a sus hijos. Ahora ella se encarga de enseñar estos conocimientos agrarios a su menor hijo, quien después de volver del colegio se va a ayudarla y así aprenden del negocio familiar. Ella espera poder mantenerse así y mas adelante empezar con otra siembra. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, por lo que espera la ayuda de todos ustedes para segui creciendo y fortaleciendo su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará semillas, y contratará jornaleros para arar la tierra para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Zoila, 57 years old, is a happy, friendly, and very enthusiastic woman. She is a mother, but is separated from her husband. She has five children, and only one still lives with her, so she is responsible for his care and education. Zoila owns the house they live in. 

She does agricultural work; since she was very young she worked her farm to cultivate, water and plow the land and care for her plants. For 30 years she has done this, and through this work she educated her children. Now she is passing on all this agrarian knowledge by teaching her youngest son. After he comes back from school he is going to help her and learn the family business. She hopes to be able to get by this way and later begin with another planting season. 

This will be loan number 16 for her with MFP, and she awaits the help of all of you so she can keep on growing and strengthening her business. With the requested amount, she will buy seeds and hire farm workers to plow the land for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and hire farm workers

loans.name: Ngep

texts.en:
Ngep is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is married to Tal who works as a rice farmer. This humble couple has given birth to three children who live under their care. Ngep is a dentist who presently runs a dental business and earns about 4 USD each day. 

Since she lacks capital, Ngep is requesting a loan to purchase some dental materials. To improve her living standards, she has decided to request this loan through the Kiva partner HKL. Her loan will be very useful for her business because she thinks new materials will attract many clients. In the future, Ngep hopes to have a comfortable house and send her children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase dental materials

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong is 33 years old, married, and lives in Prey Chor District of Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. The people in this region are dedicated to agriculture, mainly the cultivation of corn, bananas, rice and the breeding of animals. Currently, Tong is growing rice, from which she can earn $3USD per day.

She and her husband would like to expand their business, but because they lack money they are seeking a loan from Kiva partner HKL to purchase a plot of land. This loan will contribute to her financial stability and will improve the quality of her product and her farming activities. A calm, honorable and very responsible woman, Tong will be punctual in her payments. She is very grateful to all kind lenders supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married with two children. She is 45 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City.
Maribeth sells ready to wear items to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this. She has requested a loan for P 10,000 to purchase more items like shirts and pants for trading.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, she hopes to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchased items like shirts and pants for trading

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 50 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband, her in-laws and her two lovely children, who are of school age. 

Currently, Long is a rice farmer. From this business, she can gain around 1.25 USD per day. Since it is farming season, she would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva. She will use the loan to pay for plowing her fields. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and her third with HKL. She had not received a loan though another bank before, but HKL gave her loans with much better conditions at a much lower interest rate. 

She is very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her fields.

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 40 years old and lives in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamis City. She is married with two children. 
Leliosa has a shop that sells used clothing. She has had this business for fifteen years. She has requested a loan of P15,000 to purchase more used clothing to sell.
Leliosa has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Leliosa hopes to expand her business to neighboring cities.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Amornia

texts.en:
Amormia is 36 years old and lives in Kapalaran,Balangasan,Pagadian City. She is married with 6 children.
Amormia has a motorcycle for rent and earns approximately P6,000.00 per month doing this. She has requested a loan of P12,000 to purchase equipment for her motorcycle .
Amormia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future,Amormia hopes to have additional motorcycles to ren.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is married with 1 child.  He is 31 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor.  
To earn his living, Ricky owns a small retail business.  He has had this business for four years.  Each month, he earns approximately PHP 3,600.00. He has requested a loan of P10,000. Ricky has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.

In the future, Ricky hopes to be more productive with his business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery items

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek is located in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She is 53 years old, a married woman, and has seven lovely children. All of her children are singles.

Currently, Pek is a rice farmer.she is the one person who works hard for covering her family's expenses. From this business activity, she can earn approximately 1 USD per day. To assist her income, her son works as a telephone repairer in a market near her community. From this sector, her son can earn about $4USD per day. 

To upgrade their living, her son wishes to purchase additional telephone materials, but he lacks money, so he asked his parent to borrow some funds through HKL, a Kiva partner. 

Her son hopes that this loan will make his business gain more profit per day and live in good situation.

loans.use: to purchase telephone materials.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with four children. She is 39 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor. To earn a living, Amalia has a small grocery store business, one major source of income for the family.
 
She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) net income. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase assorted grocery items.
  
Amalia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Amalia hopes to gain more income and have a savings deposit for her children, so they'll have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grocery items

loans.name: Thelma Llena Group

texts.en:
Thelma is married, with 1 child.  She is 48 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudeela, Misamis Occidental.
Thelma sells shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and canned goods to earn a living, and has had this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,500PHP to purchase goods such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods.
Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Thelma hopes to save money.

Thelma is the leader of a 3 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase goods, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a 30 year-old man living in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is married to Naisan, who is in the same age. This humble couple has three children who are attending school. 

Chhun and his wife have a small fishing business. After fishing, Chhun and his wife bring their fishes to sell at the local market, which is far away from their community. From this business, they can earn about 3 USD each day. 

To upgrade their living standard, this couple wants to repair their broken house, but they are lacking money, so they wish to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva. This is their first loan so they hope that lenders will sponsor them. This lovely couple is very thankful to all sponsors who are kind.

Chhun is in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to repair their broken house.

loans.name: Grizelda

texts.en:
Grizelda is married, with 9 children. Grizelda is 44 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Grizelda has a mooring services business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. Grizelda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

She has requested a loan of PHP11,000 to purchase a pump boat for her mooring services business.  In the future, Grizelda hopes to have an expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a pump boat for her mooring services business

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is married, with 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Pereyra Village, Maningcol Ozamiz City.  Rosanna is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP14,999 to purchase equipment for her farm tractor.  Rosanna has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 3 months. In the future, Rosanna hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her farm tractor

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married, with one school-aged child. Gina is 38 years old and lives in Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
Gina sells choco balls and munchkins to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. 

She has requested a loan of PHP50,000 to purchase more ingredients needed for her business.  Gina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Gina hopes to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients needed for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in Pob2, Clarin, Mis Occ. She is married, with 5 children. Jocelyn has a fish business and earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase dried fish for her retail business.  Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is married, with 5 children. Carmelina is 60 years old and lives in San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.  Carmelina planned to have a sari-sari store to earn a living, and this is her new business.  She has requested a loan of PHP20,000 to build a store and purchase groceries to sell as her new business.
Carmelina has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Carmelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to build a store and purchase groceries to sell as her new business

location.town: San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is single and has no children. He is 46 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Mario sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this work. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase groceries for his general store. Mario has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Mario hopes to have a number of branches of his general store in the town.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for his general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with five children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Lorna is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer for the corn. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to see their children finish a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with 2 children. 

Elsie has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase goods such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her shop.
 
Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Elsie hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her shop

loans.name: Bao

texts.en:
Bao is 60 years old and married with three children.

Bao and his wife earn a living selling coffee and beverages, which they have done for the last 6 years. Bao would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of coffee and beverages to sell. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee in bulk to sell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is married with 4 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Overview, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Vevencia owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 2000 to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Vevencia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Vevencia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 34 years old and married with one son. Hong earns a living by selling coffee and beverages, which she has done for 4 years. 

Hong would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages and coffee to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, will help her to improve her family's living conditions, and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Elsa owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 to purchase groceries to sell.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang lives with her children, one son and one daughter, in Ho Chi Minh city. She sells gas containers to peopL. in her community. Hoang started this business five years ago. 

Hoang currently would like a loan to buy more gas tanks from different suppliers to better meet her customers' needs and serve a larger number of customers. 

She hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more gas tanks from different suppliers for sale

loans.name: Felicisima Group

texts.en:
Felicisima is single. Felicisima is 52 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City.
Felicisima sells snacks like sticky rice, locally know as “Biko”, to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase ingredients needed for her business.
Felicisima has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, Felicisima hopes to expand her business to the neighboring town of Ozamiz.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. To support her family, Thi earns an income by buying and selling scraps of fabric. Thi started this business four years ago. 

Thi would like to take a loan to expand her current business to include the recycling of other types of waste materials. With the loan, she will buy and process different kinds of waste materials, such as plastics, and then resell them to a wholesaler. 

Thi hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy and process waste materials for recycling.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is a 32-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 1 daughter. He earns a living running a general store, which he has done for 2 years. 

Hiep would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings for his daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock his general store

loans.name: Sinani B Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Sinani B group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Moses takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to secure enough food for the family and have additional maize to enable him to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acres of land.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in animal raising.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Geofrey is the facilitator of the Yetana group. Geofrey and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Geofrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Geofrey takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and ensure food security for the family. 

With income from the maize sales, Geofrey will invest in animal raising and repair his home.

In 2012, the members of Yetana group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Namukhe Shg Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Namukhe SHG group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to be able to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and was particularly pleased with the terms of the loan repayment, which begins early and is gradual. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With income from the maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock, which will help her repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Namukhe SHG group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of one child from Irbid, Jordan.

Hiba has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to expand her salon and purchase more cosmetics for it.

Hiba aspires to open a wedding dress section for her salon and put in new decoration for it. She is also looking to increase her family income and open new locations for her salon in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase new cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Thaer is a 23-year-old single man from Irbid, Jordan. He has a mobile phone shop and he is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars to expand his shop by purchasing more mobile phones and their accessories, in addition to new quantities of mobile prepaid cards. Thaer is looking towards opening a new branch for his shop and increasing his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and prepaid cards for mobiles.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has a party supplies shop and she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase more supplies such as chairs, blankets, etc., in addition to purchasing new party equipment. Mayson is looking to expand her shop in order to meet the demands of more wedding parties.

Due to culturA. issues, Mayson refused to use her picture on the internet; instead, her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase party supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Tessie has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel and other seafood like shrimps and crabs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Nissel has a shop where she sells sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nissel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nissel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Anilyn has a shop where she sells pillows, clothing & beauty products. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stock like clothing & pillows from DAKKI & AVON to sell.

Anilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like clothing & pillows for sell from DAKKI & AVON.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Geralyn has a shop business, buying and peddling fish like sardines, flying fish & milk fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Geralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geralyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Expedita has a shop that sells coconut & wood charcoal by the sack. Her husband provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy the raw materials needed for making wood & coconut charcoal.
Expedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Expedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials needed for making wood & coconut charcoal.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Susana has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, noodles & beverages to sell.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, noodles & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Marlene buys and sells chickens, pigs and goats. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy young pigs, chicks and goats to sell in the future.

Marlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Marlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy young pigs, chicks and goats to sell in the future.

loans.name: Jaime Ramel

texts.en:
Jaime Ramel is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Jaime Ramel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jaime Ramel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jaime Ramel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Adelia has a shop that buys and sells generic drugs and medicinal and herbal ointments. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy generic drugs and medicinal ointments to sell.

Adelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy generic drugs and medicinal ointments to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is a 38-year-old married woman with one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ha earns a living by running a general store, which she has done for seven years. Ha would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ruel is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for seven years. He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 49-year old married mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Loan and her husband run a small general store selling food products and household necessities in their community. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Loan would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic foods to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic foods to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 70 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Irene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 21 years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en:
Nhu is a 38-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past 15 years, Nhu has supported his family by repairing and replacing locks in his local community. Nhu would like to take a loan to invest in his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of locks and new equipment for his business in order to better meet his customers' needs.

Through the loan, he hopes that he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new locks and equipment for his lock repairing business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children.
 
Carlos has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He is also buying and selling chickens/broilers. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 44, is the mother of two sons. Together with her husband and children, she lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy and her husband earn an income from selling many kinds of sweet soups, jelly and sweets from her stall in a local street market. She began this business 10 years ago.

Thuy would like to take a loan to buy ingredients to increase her production and diversify the range of sweet soups, sweets and jellies that she makes. She hopes that this will enabL. her to attract more customers. 

She also hopes that, through the loan, she will be abL. to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and materials to make sweet soup for selling.

loans.name: Alma Vee

texts.en:
Alma Vee is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Alma Vee has a tailoring shop; she sews office and school uniforms. She is also into repairing some dresses and uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials needed for tailoring, like cloth.

Alma Vee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma Vee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for tailoring, like cloth.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Angelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Angelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with nine children. 

Romeo is buying and selling coconuts for copra & green bananas. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Eva has a shop that makes & sells hypo or cleansing agent by the liter. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.
