loans.name: Kibeu B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wilkister and the farmers of Kibeu B group. Wilkister is the Kibeu B facilitator. She and her group are in preparation for the 2012 One Acre Fund program.

Like most farmers in this area of Western Kenya, the farmers of Kibeu B rely on their maize harvests for their family’s food security, and as a significant income resource throughout the year.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilkister and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Wilkister takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and to ensure food security for the family.

With income from the maize sales, Wilkister will educate her children and invest in livestock. 

In 2012, the members of Kibeu B group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is a 34-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her children, one son and one daughter, in Ho Chi Minh City. For the last three years she has operated a food stall selling meals to people in her community.
Tu would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 
She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, food and rice for her stall.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a 42-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.
Thao has run a food stall in front of their house for the past six years. She sells many kind of soups and noodles. Thao would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and good quality materials. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, cooking appliances, and good quality materials.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 51-year-old married woman with five children: three sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a farmer and raises pigs. 
For the past ten years, Huong has supported her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells a large range of products from household items to personal use products. 
Huong would like a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 51 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Hanh's husband earns money as a bricklayer. 
Hanh earns an income to support her family by running a general store from her house. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery. She hope that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en:
Phuc is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years she and her husband have operated a food stall to sell meals for vegetarians in their community.
Phuc would like a loan to repair her stall and purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to repair her stall and purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Enjeresha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Violet is the facilitator of the Enjeresha group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and ensure food security for the family. 

With income from the maize sales, Violet will pay her loan and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Enjeresha group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kapatu W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maximillah and the members of Kapatu WG group in Western Kenya!  Maximillah is the Kapatu WG facilitator. She and her co-group members joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Like the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, the farmers of Kapatu WG group farm maize as a staple crop.  They will receive in-kind input loans from One Acre Fund to plant maize in 2012.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maximillah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Maximillah takes care of six children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for the family and to be able to access fertilizer and high quality hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Maximillah had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Maximillah was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With income from the maize sales, Maximillah will invest in her children's education.

In 2012, the members of Kapatu WG group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 2 acres of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora mujer trabajadora, emprendedora de profesión costurera, su hijo estudia, su esposo jubilado. La mejora de su vivienda es unos de los planes para ofrecerle mayor comodidad a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara tela, hilos, abujas, encajes entre otros productos. Para ser utilizado en el mejoramiento de su negocio. Nuestra clienta elabora cobertores, delantales, cortinas, blusas, etc. Generándole mayores utilidades.
texts.en: Pastora is a hardworking woman of the sewing profession. Her son studies, and her husband is retired. One of her goals is to improve her home to be more comfortable for her family. With the loan she will buy fabric, thread, needles, lace, and other items to be used in improving her business, generating greater profits. She makes bedspreads, aprons, curtains, blouses, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, lace, and other supplies

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es:
Bemilda soltera, su oficio es comerciante, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora tiene su propio negocio. Sus planes es mejorar su nivel de vida para ofrecerle mejores alternativa a su familia.  Con el préstamo comprara: gaseosa, repostería, arroz, frijoles, carnes, aceites, jabones, artículos de uso personal, lácteo, galletas, enlatados, embutidos entre otros producto que vende y usa en su negocio. Generándole utilidad.
Agradece a la financiera por e apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Bemilda is a hardworking, enterprising single woman who has her own business. She runs a general store. Her goals include improving her situation in life so she can offer better opportunities to her family. With the loan she will buy sodas, baked goods, rice, beans, meats, oils, soap, personal items, dairy products, cookies, canned goods, cold cuts and other products to sell and use in her business, generating more profits. She is thankful to the lenders for supporting the development of her business and improving her situation in life.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: José es casado, hombre trabajador, de oficio comerciante, desde hace un tiempo tiene su propio negocio, juegos mecánicos para niños, como carrusel. recorre diferentes lugares. Su proyecto es ampliar su negocio, ingresar nuevas máquinas de juego. Su esposa le apoya constantemente. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, perlines, laminas de zinc, piedrín, bloques, piedras canteras, golosos, pintura de acero, alambre de amarre, clavos, entre otros materiales. Para la construcción de una pared que requiere para seguridad de su familia.
texts.en: Jose is a hardworking married man who works in retail trade.  He has had his own business for some time now, which is mechanical games for children such as carousels.  He moves around to different locations with the games. His goal is to have more business by adding new games.  His wife gives him constant support.  With the loan he will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, support beams, sheets of corrugated metal, gravel, cement blocks, quarry stone, screws, metal paint, tie wire, nails and other materials.  He will use the materials to build a wall that he needs for the security of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Carmen Azucena

texts.es:
Carmen mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, sus hijos estudian, trabaja desde hace tiempo como operaria. Su esposo le ayuda económicamente.
Sus planes es cambiar su nivel de vida para que sus hijos obtengan mejores oportunidades. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, piedrín, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, alambre de amarre, golosas entre otros materiales. Para construir muro perimetral. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  Her children go to school.  She has worked for a long time as a operator.  Her husband helps her financially.
Her plan is to change her standard of living so that her children can have better opportunities.  With the loan, Carmen will purchase construction materials: cement, gravel, sand, blocks, quarried rock, iron, tie wire and screws, among other materials.  She needs the materials to build a perimeter wall.  Carmen is grateful to the finance company for their support in improving the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Na'el

texts.en: Na'el is a 33-year-old young man who is married and works as a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. Na'el wants to purchase new home furniture to improve his family's standard of living. Due to his modest salary, the amount of money he has isn't sufficient, so he wants to take a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Na'el gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase new home furniture and live with his family in better living conditions. Na'el is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 46-year-old married woman, with three sons and two daughters. Her husband and one of her sons are workers with modest salaries. 
Hiyam has her own project, which is raising sheep. She benefits from the sale of sheep products and therefore shares in meeting life's expenses. Hiyam wants to improve her project by purchasing more sheep to increase her income, especially because the area where she lives is known for raising sheep. She has insufficient funds to do this, so she needs to take a loan of 1,500 JOD from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Hiyam gets her FATEN loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will improve her project and purchase more sheep. She will be able to sell more of their products to increase her income, which will improve her family life and bring about better living conditions. 
Hiyam and her husband are photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to improve her project of raising sheep and purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Zuhriya

texts.en:
Zuhriya is a 41-year-old married woman who has seven sons and seven daughters. She lives in Aneen village, near Jenin city in Palestine. Zuhriya and her family have a grocery store and she wants to purchase more groceries so that she has more stock to sell. In this way, she hopes to improve the family income. The family has another source of income from agriculture. 
Zuhriya has some money, but it is not enough, so she wants to take a loan of $700 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Zuhriya takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more groceries and have a better variety of stock to sell. She will then be able to share in improving the family income and live in better conditions. 
Zuhriya is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 42-year-old married woman who has six sons and three daughters. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. 
Sameera has her own project, which is making dusters for sale. In this way, she shares with the family in meeting life's expenses. Sameera wants to purchase raw materials for making dusters, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan of $500 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Sameera takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the required raw materials and produce more dusters to sell. This will increase her income and enable her to have better living conditions. 
Sameera is photographed holding one of the dusters that she makes.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to produce dusters to sell.
